On previous visit I went on the weekend and although enjoyable this time we went first thing on a Monday. Just terrific as no crowds and you really had the place to yourselves. Like us, our art loving friends were blown away by the art on offer. But this is a great destination

The Hakone Open-Air Museum winds around a walking path with amazing sculptures and artwork practically everywhere you look. Some of the sculptures were amazing and the talent exhibited is mind boggling.

The Hakone open garden is an open sculptures garden with both international artists and Japanese. The garden is as you would expect from a Japanese garden indeed beautiful. There is also a Picasso pavilion with a very nice collection of Picasso's works. It is worth while a

It is more a open art gallery then a museum. There are sculptures located all over the park which is very pretty in autumn with the leaves turning red, yellow and brown. The location is in a hiily area with magnificent views. There is a building dedicated to Picasso with his
A beautiful open air museum with world famous artists of contemporary art and a special pavilion devoted to Pablo Picasso .also special artistic playing grounds for children . Restaurant and shop .

I have taken eleven vacations with the same tour company, and one of the many reasons why is that our outings always include wonderful destinations. The Open Air Museum was among my favorites in Japan . . . and come to think of it, among my favorites in the world. You walk into

I loved this open air museum. It is primarily sculptures with the exception of an extensive exhibit on Picasso. It was such a different way to view artwork, and the space definitely enhanced the pieces, many of which were just very large and would be difficult in a regular
we didn't know what to expect - and the Hakone open-air museum took us by surprise. Do not miss it when in Hakone
WOW! Not quite knowing what to expect, we went late one afternoon and were absolutely blown away by the museum. Amazing and unique experience and a definite must if you are in the Hakone area.

This is one of our very favorite places in Japan! We lived in Japan 38 years ago for a three year period and visited Choukoku no mori many times. It was lovely to go back this year and see that it is even more incredible having greatly expanded its collection. The expansion is

Beautiful location of perfectly maintain gardens with some amazing sculptures. I am a massive fan of Henry Moore so I particularly loved seeing all his work. The Picasso museum also had interest work that I hadn’t seen before. A lovely gentleman had convinced us to put our feet
A must see in the area. You won't miss it if you are traveling around. We had a cold and rainy day so soaking our legs in the hot water was great

Beautiful museum both indoors and outdoors in amazing setting in Hakone. Stroll around and look at the statues while enjoying the nature around you. The audio guides are a must for really enjoying this museum. Fun to see several Milles statues in this park far from Sweden!

Did'nt know quite what to expect,but was amazed at the size,layout and quality of the exhibits. Stunning gardens with amazing artwork situated all around,some interactive as well. Not a fan of Picasso but interesting to view,also Henry Moore and Rubin as well. Big cafe if you

I was very pleasantly surprised by this place. It was huge and beautifully landscaped. The captivating and thought provoking sculptures were tastefully placed in various locations in the park. The highlight was the Symphony Tower where there is a surprise awaiting you !

The Open Air Art Gallery is a wonderful addition to this area. It places beautiful pieces such as sculptures and interactive experiences in harmony with gorgeous grounds. It is a visual feast and affords lots of sensory experiences. Caters very well for children too It is a

The Open Air Museum was on our must see list. The trails were a challenge for me since I have problems walking but the gardens, works of art and Picasso gallery made it worth while. In better weather it would be a great place to let kids run and get out their energy. I highly

We only had one day in the Hakone area and generally it is recommended that you stay overnight. Either way the Hakone open air museum is a must do. We were enthralled by not only the quality of the pieces but the manner in which they are so beautifully laid out in the gorgeous
very interesting concept, lots of nice statues and interesting pavillion dedicated to Picasso. Foot hot bath was great to introduce our kids to onsen.

The weather, while we were in Hakone, was simply not cooperating, so I thought my travel companion was crazy when he suggested going to an outdoor sculpture garden on an inarguably hideous kind of day. However, after showing me some of the art installments online, I was
Our tour guide, Shin Kaneko, included this stop in our tour of Hakone. The outdoor museum is absolutely beautiful. The outdoor sculptures are amazing. The grounds are lovely too.

Day trip from Odawara on the free pass circuit. Spent most of our day here with family 3 older kids 2 adults. Loved it. Great space, foot spa, Picasso’s not seen before, glass, bronze, nature, art, fried egg seating! Great place for a good few hours.
A most impressive large garden beautifully displays a variety of sculptures. Even if not a fan of Picasso, the collection is worth seeing.

This is probably the best art museum I have ever been to. It has a wide variety of outdoor sculptures in a beautiful spacious setting, and also has an indoor Picasso exhibition. You can easily spend two or three hours here, so it is good value for money.
Loved this museum, & a great place for kids too. Some terrific pieces of artwork and a leisurely walk, even in the rain. Stayed here for lunch, good food, reasonably priced. A must see!

Although I am not an art lover or one who loves sculpture, this museum is worth a visit. There is ample parking space and easy to move around inside the museum. It is huge and most exhibits are outdoor. This is best done when it is not raining. Look for in-door museums on a
Fantastic exhibition. Both the outdoor sculptures and the Picasso exhibition. We went on a very wet day but that didn't deter us. The foot bath was a nice treat for our cold, wet feet.

Despite the crappy weather we really enjoyed this museum, it really has so much to see. If you have the Hakone Free Pass, make sure you show it when you buy your tickets as you’ll save 400¥ per ticket. The Picasso exhibit is particularly impressive with over 300 items, and

This is l gem. An open air sculpture museum with an indoor Picasso gallery. We visited on a beautiful sunny day which made enjoying the pieces outdoors a real pleasure given the beautiful scenery. It’s a short walk from the station and the best stop off we made on the Hakone

We took the Local train from the main station to the Open Air Museum that is 85% outdoors. We had a beautiful sunny day in this museum set amongst beautiful mountain scenery. Great areas for kids to play. Excellent exhibits. We cannot say enough great things about this

Excellent visit....it is on most 'must see' places in Hakone and concur. Took our 2 kids (10 and 12) and they enjoyed some of the kids activities while my wife and I toured museum as well. Excellent Picasso exhibit. Wow. Hot foot bath overlooking the museum and mountains
Quite large outdoor Museum with many artefacts and inspiring to take a long walk there. I recommend the Picasso exhibition inside the museum.

Was very impressed by the range of sculptures and art pieces (especially Picasso’s) at this Museum. Love the open air layout and arrangement of the different pieces around the different parts of a large open area blending both nature and art beautifully together. My favourite is

An outdoor museum in beautiful scenery. featuring sculptures by Henry Moore and Rodin and many others. There is an art gallery devoted to the life and works of Picasso showcasing paintings and sculptures by the artist. It is a tiring climb up the Symphonic Sculpture (a type of

Great art work both inside and outside. Stained glass sculpture was amazing. The Picasso pavilion was large and unexpectedly had hundreds on pictures, sculptures, ceramics and prints. A must see if in the Hakone area.

As an art exhibition, the entrance fee is higher than the usual temples and shrines, but I was actually pretty impressed at the space they had dedicated to the many large and varied works around the museum. Like many art places, I don't have to like everything, but there was

We went as a couple but also wonderful for families. Don't miss the Picasso pavilion and make sure not to skip the foot bath! They also offer a 100 yen towels there. Sculptures are great and very diverse between many types of art.

Our visit to Hakone did not unfold as expected: the rope way was closed due to volcanic gases (and smelly they were too) and it was very cloudy and so there was no view of Mount Fuji. But the Open Air Museum did not disappoint. It was beautifully laid out with some excellent

We stopped off here on our way back to Tokyo having spent a night at the top of Ashinoko lake then used the ropeway and then trains to head home. Everything is well sigh posted throughout this trip which is great! We got off at chokoku station second stop on the train after

I absolutely loved this museum! Henry Moore, Miro, Giacometti, Picasso, Rodin just to name a few, combined withso many wonderful Japanese artists. It has so many amazing sculptures & the grounds are wonderful. Set in a fantastic location, surrounded by the mountains of Hakone,
I was expecting to spend an hour here with my family before they got bored but we ended up staying for 6 hrs with no complaints. Beautiful pieces and lovely gardens.

I thought some of the art here was very interesting. It was not my desire to really go to this museum, I am not an artsy person, but I still had a nice time here, the area where you can put your feet into a warm stream after walking a lot was also pretty awesome.

Nice if you are here on a sunny warm day. Nothing too amazing, but good if you are here when they have open-air live shows. No BBQ allowed, but you can rent the hut to cater food and drinks. Good for company events as well.

This is a great place to visit in Hakone. When we arrived there was some light rain, which was irksome, but did not stop us from appreciating the museum. We enjoyed casually walking through the gardens and viewing the installations. If you have going children there are a few

This is a very well kept park with lots of interesting modern sculptures and buildings dotted around, some of which can be climbed in by adults or children. There is also a free foot spa at the far end so that you can refresh those tired feet! Very pleasant, but I felt that the

The hillside setting sets the scene for a magnificent day out. The Japanese and Western sculptures are well set out and presented. Some are breathtaking. There is also a beautiful selection of art with well known artists such as Picasso and Rodin to enjoy. Well worth a visit, in

Can spend almost half a day here with kids. They would enjoy this place with lot of fun activities for them. Very interesting display of scientific concepts, Artistic models both indoor and outdoors. One of the best places to visit in Japan.
Great place to visit during Hakone visit. The items on show are funky and the free foot spa is mega cool.

Amazing place , trip to Hakone is incomplete without a visit to this museum. Enjoyed every bit of it in the rainy weather. Loved the Picasso museum and open air sculptures. My favourite was Symphony Sculpture Tower.

There were lots to see at the Open Air Musuem. Mostly statues outdoors and several exhibitions indoors including the Picasso's! It's a great way to be immersed in both Art and Nature. There are several activities catered for kids, they looked so fun even to an adult! Set aside
Outside of the many hotsprings in the local area, there are a few places to visit. This museum is worth the time and effort to get there and enjoy.

Allow yourself 2 hours to stroll the open air sculptures. Grounds are in immaculate condition. The permanent indoor Picasso exhibit alone is worth the entrance fee of 1600 yen. Some excellent places to eat just outside the entrance.

I wasn't expecting to enjoy this place, and it was a last minute substitution on our tour only because the Owakudani Valley was closed to visitors because of recent volcanic sulfur fumes. But I ended up thoroughly enjoying it, even in a light rain. Wander the paved pathways to
We found it very interesting to walk outside between the great mountains of Hakone with the lovely fresh air with a wonderful view and enjoy international art in the same time!

The most amazing outdoor museum, a must for all visitors to Hakone. Brilliant art, cleverly placed and a great place for kids though ours are fully grown. A wander through takes a couple of hours, there is so much to see with a large collection of Picasso in an indoor gallery.

My husband and I were staying in Gora at one of the onsen hotels and due to jetlag, made it through the standard Hakone ropeway, cable car, pirate ship, check point, cedar avenue and ports really quickly. We managed to catch a glimpse of the open air museum on our way back and

I wasn't sure first if we were going to do this on a recent visit to Hakone. Hakone was just a day trip for us and didn't know if I wanted to take time away from the rest of Hakone to explore this. Im glad we did. Hakone area was VERY busy the Saturday we came so long lines

This was a real surprise. A very good, international, collection of outdoor sculpture pieces as well as a large indoor Picasso exhibit. In a lovely mountainside setting Well worth the strep tickets price.

What a lovely place - the art is beautiful and nicely laid out - we just loved that they welcomed children - so many activities geared to young children - our kids were too old of course but we think that this was very nice. The Picasso rooms are ok - but the real highlight was
google: This place was a great place for adults and children. Parking on-site, bring ticket to the pass gate for ¥500 all day fee. You will love walking through this park. Give yourself at least 3 hours as they close at 5:00pm.  There are so many picture perfect sites. Bring a picnic too.

One of the best open-air museums in the world. A whole day is needed here to appreciate the works of art and the marvellous scenery they are displayed within.

You will sure need to use the water troughs to dip your aching feet into, after your trip.

It’s is very easy to access via Hakone Tongan local train. 
By bus you need to walk for more that 5-8 mins.

Every time we visit this place we like it even better.
Great outdoor place with free space for kids to roam and play. 
We got to …

Nice walk outside among the artworks. There's also a small building inside the park with an interesting exhibition about Picasso.  It was quite English friendly.
I didn't put 5 stars just because most of the art pieces are European (especially France) and I wished more diversity. It doesn't mean I don't recommend it though.

Fantastic museum. This might be the best art museum I've ever been to! So much fun, so well maintained. I recommend this place enough. You can spend a good few hours here. There's something for everyone. I was surprised just ow big this open museum is. Very good value for money.

I can't really express how cool this place is.  If you're in Hakone, this is a must visit destination.  You're guaranteed to get beautiful pictures no matter what you photograph.  A lot of very cool and interesting sculptures.  Walking the …

There's parking for groups and families, there was 5 of us we paid 500Y but got 5 hours instead of paying hourly when we showed our parking ticket at the ticket booth. Excellent tourist destination especially if you like Picasso, abstract …

I think this is my favorite museum I have ever visited.  I really enjoyed this spot and thought that the open-air museum concept with a walkable large space with tons of sculptures and interactive displays was excellent. 

This museum is …

Fantastic ans interesting outdoor museum to scroll around and enjoy the creative art. Foot bath was there to enjoy when tired after long walk. Even kids have some creative art playground for them, suitable for all family.  Highly recommend to visit here if you ate in Hakone.

A must see for any one in this part of the world. One of the most beautiful and entertaining Museums I have every been too. Kids even love this place. Art lovers will be blown away by its pieces, engineers and architects will be inspired by their audacity and lovers of the outdoors will love the walks designed.

Beautiful place to visit on a fine day if you are in Hakone area. Appreciating art pieces well maintained by the museum in the outdoor with the breathtaking mountainous backdrop. Really worth the bus ride here.
Also houses a Picasso musuem …

Beautiful art museum. The outdoor air felt nice while enjoying some sculptures and art. Some of the art is indoors but much of the museum is outside. There is also a nice place for a free foot bath that felt nice. Highly recommend visit.

a wonderful spot full of surprises in Hakone, a must do.. many sculptures and masterpieces besides Picasso museum offering a complete biography on his personal and professional life. You can easily spend 2h in there

Definitely worth spending time here. A very unique outdoor museum. Probably the first ever experience for me. Lots of statue pieces and a dedicated section for picasso. Beware! One may spend a few hours here. Plan your time well.
Best museum we have been!  Beautiful landscape and very well organized with the great works of art! Amazing!

A fascinating place with lots to see. Some really interesting sculptures - both classically inspired and modern. Lots of fun activities for children to do. Also, loved the foot bath! A really nice touch after all that walking.

Fantastic pieces, incredible experience. One of the most exciting museums I've ever been into. A must do experience for someone who likes it. 
Amazing to have this 'open air' exhibition.

An absolutely fantastic museum/ gallery for people of all ages. Some wonderful pieces of art and sculptures set in a lovely garden. Could easily spend a few hours here. Includes a good sized gift shop, cafe, and other installations.

Lots of interesting art to see here! A great place to spend the day exploring, but would avoid going in summer as it's too hot. They also have two massive installations for children to climb into and play around in. Like an artistic playground - if only they allowed adults too!

Scenic views, tide gardens, nice pieces of arts. Foot bath is a plus. There are also two spaces for kids that are fantastic. Fortunately, during the winter holidays the museum is open until 6pm and it is possible to enjoy another art with lanterns, lights and sound. A must see in Hakone.

This was a treat. Whilst it was an open air museum it also art collections in museum halls. There was a play section for children, a reasonable sized cafeteria. Strongly recommend it, it is a great collection and nice location.

Unique, interesting, mostly open air sculpture museum. Reasonably priced, wonderful location on the side of a beautiful mountain. Many of the sculptures are meant to be interacted with, since specifically by children only. Took me roughly …

Quite enjoyable. Spacious place with plenty to see. The garden is interesting and very much family friendly. I like the warm foot spa on open air while looking over the pretty tower. I also like the Picasso building, too bad no camera is allowed in there.

Hakone Chōkoku No Mori Bijutsukan) successfully attempts to create a harmonic balance of nature and art by exhibiting various sculptures on its grounds in combination with views of the surrounding valley and mountains.
The museum has …
A fun museum with interesting exhibits and a nice backdrop of mountain views. Came back a few times.
Far more than I had expected!  Surprised if wasn't more famous and popular!!  The openness, the unique sculptures, and the beautiful Hakone as backdrop.  Amazing place,  do not miss!
Some of the pieces here are breathtaking. I'd advise you try to go on a nice day as the name implies, 90% of everything is outside.

Great way of spending many hours strolling through the gardens and enjoying many forms of artwork. Really surprised I enjoyed it so much to be honest... Oh, don't do this on a wet day for obvious reasons...

One of a kind museum, was great to walk around outside and see these amazing pieces of art. Lucky we had good weather as it would be hard visiting here on a rainy day. There is also a natural springs foot spa, so make sure you don't miss it.
Have to pay for parking on-top of your entry ticket.

Really didn't know what I was getting into with this, but the exhibit was fascinating. The sculptures are mostly contemporary with a few older selections. I would highly recommend it if you're in the area. Plenty of fun photo opportunities and some fantastic art.
Fantastic museum for adults and kids ! Amazing playground

Excellent place to view all the creative exhibits.  Good to spent half a day there.  Lots of open space.  Nice gallery with lots of exhibit for those loves art.  There is also some play exhibits for kids to climb and play.  Wonderful concepts.
Such a great experience to combine art and nature.

If you are in the Hakone region this museum is a must see.  The outdoor sculptures and art works amidst the backdrop of the mountains and trees is breathtaking.   It is worth taking your time and enjoying the art and nature.

Easily one of the best art museums in Japan! The location is obviously a big reason why it’s so impactful. The mountain scenery provides a beautiful backdrop to the sculptures, and it also changes how you might view those pieces (as opposed …

Oh wow. I love the hakone open air museum. The location of the museum was amazing as it is located on a very large greenery mountainous park. The arts are very impressive. I was able to interact with some of the exhibits which made my …

Beautiful museum that combines art with nature and life - stunning exhibits set against the backdrop of the surrounding mountains. The art and facilities are very well maintained by the museum staff. There is a particularly beautiful …
Must-visit place in Hakone. The Picasso pavillion is fantastic
Fun place to go on a date. Really nice for families with kids, too!

This was way better than I had expected. We spent about an hour and a half wandering f around.  The grounds were beautiful and the sculptures were really interesting. The Picasso gallery was an awesome exhibit as well. Definitely check it out!

This museum is truly amazing! Give yourself at least 2 to 3 hours to properly enjoy it. The Picasso museum itself is outstanding and these so many little books and crannies within the museum to find and explore. I almost went back since I was a little rushed at the end
Very beautiful, pretty cheap, has children areas, and it's in the hilside so the views are amazing

The amazing exhibitions are complimented by the beautiful landscape and autumn foliage of Hakone. There’s a Picasso Pavilion with a large quantity of artworks (photography not allowed). We also enjoyed the foot path in the museum. Allow at least 2 hours there to fully enjoy the experience.
Amazing relaxing place you must visit, especially in early summer or early fall.
Well worth a visit.various sculptures and galleries are sprawled out across a picturesque space so Even if it's busy you can enjoy in peace
Was good to just wander around and see the sculptures. Some closed but there was still plenty to see

Beautiful landscape and exhibition of modern art. Everything is perfectly kept and it's amazing walking in the park and enjoying art at the same time. The Picasso and Manzú expo are very interesting and add a very good reason to go.

Unique setting - well worth a visit. We enjoyed every bit of this experience from the many unusual sculptures set in the beautiful garden to the works of Picasso. Wish we'd had a bit more time to explore. Allow at least 3 hours.

A must if you're visiting Hakone. I squeezed it in my day trip to Hakone and even though it's not part of the hakone free pass, still worth a stop to enjoy the wonderful sculptures with the scenic landscapes as its backdrop. I'm clueless about art but I still enjoyed the exhibits and the Picasso exhibition.

What a wonderful experience to walk through the grounds of the open air museum on a perfect winters day.There is something for everyone, from the youngest to the oldest. Children are catered for by having access to two dedicated play areas …

We were really impressed with this museum, not only it was very beautiful but also interactive and fun. The landscape and the sculptures work together in harmony to produce a very pleasant open air museum.
Excellent place to walk along with your kids and whole family !! Lots of chances for good discussion and creative view points.

Extremely unique experience. Most of the exhibit is outdoors so be sure to dress warm. If you go at night you recieve a lantern to walk the paths which is a nice touch. Bring a small towel with you for the foot hot spring too save the cost of the face towel

A wonderful open space with a variety of sculptures by world renowned artists on display. The entire space has been staged in a way that allows the sculptures to work with the natural environment around them, or occasionally to provide a …
Value for money, can easily spend an afternoon there, be prepared to do lots of walking. Enjoy a discount if you have purchased a Hakone free pass.

Pretty stunning outdoor museum. It’s huge! You could easily spend a couple hours here. Nestled into the Hakone mountainside, when there’s a clear blue sky... it’s bliss. Really fun sculptures to look at and there’s something for folks of …
If you are an art lover. This is good place to visit

Do not miss! Hakone surprisingly was the best day of our compact 7 day itinerary in Japan and boy! Did this place set the tone for a soothing experiential value.

The museum is spread across a scenic landscape. Feel free to walk through the …
An amazing collection at an amazing location. Great for kids too.

A wonderful outdoor sculpture museum with a dedicated building to Picasso.  It is larger than expected making for a nice stroll even if you are not an art lover.  The collection is excellent with famous artists represented from all over the …

This is a great park to enjoy the open air and beautiful surroundings if weather permits. Sadly we were there on a rainy day, and all the mountains were invisible.  The exhibition is alright as for a modern art museum.

If it isn't rainy, definitely go to the Hakone Open Air Museum! I'm not a huge art fanatic but I do appreciate art so it was nice to walk around in the fresh air looking at everything. 
They have parking on-site but it does cost 500 yen.

Super cool museum. We spent a good number of hours there and felt we could stay even longer. Lots of fun photo shoot opportunities. A beautiful park made even better with the art. I enjoyed it even through the pain of an appendicitis which …

Beautiful park with modern art installations.

There are two interactive installations which allows for kids to climb and play. Our kids could spend hours there, and it adds a dimension for the kids.

Family friendly.

A must go when traveling to Hakone. The Hakone Open Air Museum has over 1,000 sculptures including works of Pablo Picasso, Henry Moore, Chagall, Renoir, Miró, Isamu Noguchi (special exhibition) and others.
Can easily spend an entire day in here - fun for kids as well. Visiting on a rainy day or after snow is magical as well.

An excellent gallery to visit - the gallery itself is 95% outdoors and open to the elements.  The gardens and areas around the museum are impeccably maintained.  Well worth the price of admission. Allow yourself one or two hours to take in all of the pieces and to peruse the gift shops.

Picasso and other artists sculpture and art pieces presented in an open interactive environment and gallery state. Pretty interesting way to present art forms in a mountainous natural environment rather than an artistic heavy environment. …
Interesting arts, Good view and nice place for walk.

Worth visit if you like modern arts. The  masterpieces are embedded in a very nice garden. There is also an Picass.o museum. Entrance is abt. 1600 Yen There is also a cafe to have a brake before or after the visit.
Very cool art and sculptures! Picasso exhibit is very neat.
Beautiful location and art accessible for everybody, from kids to adults
Amazing place! Along with the stunning art that is displayed, they have a very cool gift shop!

Quite enjoyable. Spacious place with plenty to see. The garden is interesting and very much family friendly. I like the warm foot spa on open air while looking over the pretty tower. I also like the Picasso building, too bad no camera is allowed in there.
Amazing place. Grate scalpture art and very unique picasso museum
One of the best museums ever. The concept, the works in display with the nature as the background, the staff... all amazing. Just a pity that some works were being maintained
This place is a must see! Amazing art work a spectacular view of the mountains. Would considering coming back just for this museum!

One of my favorite museums IN THE WORLD. Most of the artworks are great however the experience of seeing these pieces in the amazing landscape creates a unique experience no other museum can provide. The combination of the sculptures with the nature creates an unforgettable memory. Super recommended.

An absolutely beautiful museum, and probably one of the few museums in the world where you can rest your feet in a hot spring whilst taking in sculptures. Some very impressive sculptures. Very good place to bring under 12s as the museum has some fun activities such as a "climbing diamond" and a "climbing lattice".

text.quote: Charming museum on scenic grounds featuring Venetian glassware, plus a gift shop & Italian eatery.
trip: I love the Hakone Glass Forest. We enjoyed our time there. The glass creations are splendid. Would visit again.
A little piece of Italy in Japan. See in gardens their is a range of Venetian glass small and large on display. It was relaxing wandering through the gardens looking at pieces

I was there just before darkness. So I started to view the outside items by daylight and then the lights turned on and it became fairyland. Really beautiful. The inside works are also nice but I liked the garden better.

We were disappointed in this one. It was pricier than other places (1500 yen) and not as engaging, nor as big as the Kawaguchiko Music Forest place we were at earlier in our trip. (We could be wrong, but it looked like the same people did both places.) With all the other options

I was expecting a “ vases in glass cases “ museum instead the exhibits included work by some of the world’s best known glass artists including Dale Chihuly and collaborative works with Pablo Picasso and Marc Chagal . Truly impressive !! The pizza’s good as well . Overall
Remarkable exhibition, beautiful grounds, pleasant italian restaurant, the. Objects available for purchase are reasonably priced. Easily accessible by local bus.

If you've been to Italy and around Europe, you'll definitely feel that this place is a bit small and expensive, though the crafts are definitely venetian authentic. As someone who'd been to Venice many times, I would say the items at their store are really expensive (not to

This was a treat to find and the glass peices are just a site to behold.there were glass flowers that complemented the real flowers and gardens of life like glass flowers.and in the show room there was jewelry and ornament of great quality

Besides osaka and tokyo that is a must we also did hakone one of best hill stations town side of japan. U should not miss kyoto and hakone. We stayed in Highland hotel for 2 days just next to glass museum. Nice to see ancient glass works store where u can also buy them. Hakone
The glass exhibitions were amazing and the pleasant surrounds including places to eat was a real surprise. Easy to get to by local bus. .

I was a bit hesitant about visiting due to the mixed reviews here but felt that they prepared me for the experience. We went on a lovely sunny day so all the outdoor exhibits were lovely & sparkly. I was a bit disappointed that renovations were going on which rather spoiled the

The Hakone Glass Forest, as the whole compound is called, is decorated as an Italian/Venetian village, with lots of glass art installations. The tunnel of glass crystals is eye-catching, especially during a sunny day. The indoor Venetian Glass Museum goes further in-depth with

We found this by sheer luck and we were blown away by how beautifully everything is displayed and how lovely the whole place is. The collection is definitely one of the best I have ever seen and worth the visit.
If you are in Japan you may choose other places to spend your previous time. But.... the Italian restaurant is good (very few menus options) with music. Good relief from the sushi ;)

We first visited the outdoor garden, which the scenery was beautiful, with a lake in middle, several Italian-styled buildings, glass sculptures, a great backdrop against the mountain and everywhere partially covered with snow during our visit. After the tour in the garden, we

The museum exhibits all Venetian glass pieces and photos of different facial expressions. Outside the museum house are trees hanging crystals and shines beautifully under the sun. There were different show performance during the period I visited and the violin performance was

Hakone glass museum is the first art museum in Japan specializing in Venetian glasses. Located in Sengokura, in the northern part of Hakone, it is boasting with modern and classic vases, goblets, lamps, and sculptures. A beautiful landscape, a large garden surrounding a canal
OK. A bit kitchy and yes the trees and waterfall are small hanging crystals but the museum houses some very nice pieces of Venetian glass from over time. It is worth a stop.
One of the highlights of our trip has to be this Venetian museum. The outdoor structures and pieces were literally wow material. Lots of great photo opportunities too!

A fascinating garden with a wide collection of amazing Venetian art pieces. Lots of Instagram moments and just to enjoy the pieces. Should allocate more than 2-3 hrs here even though it’s a small place

Love this place! Even though the visit was on a rainy day in Autumn the Crystal glass on the tree branches were magnificent!The walk around the museum was like walking into a fairytale story.The coffee shop and restaurant looked good but as every where in Japan the queue was

The glasswork is certainly impressive, even on an overcast and rainy day. I loved how the glass was incorporated into the beautiful garden areas. Amazing glasswork in the museum, a very diverse collection throughout.

Looks like part of a fairy tale with the crystal trees and curtain. Great indoor display in French style buildings. Beautiful garden with a selection of restaurants. We sat outside with a glass of wine and just enjoyed the scenery.

Both classical pieces of Venetian glass and modern creations. Well curated in a garden setting with a river running at the bottom of the garden. The variety in the collection is stunning - from the figurative to the abstract, from the beautiful to the bizarre. Recommended.
I was not sure what to expect when I went to this museum. I would highly recommend if you get the opportunity. Some amazing glass art. Beautiful scenery! Do not miss it!

text.quote: Former imperial palace complex offering walking paths & an observation platform with scenic views.
trip: We arrived to Hakone by ferry and decided to walk to Moto Hakone. This park was between and offers nice view to the lake. There are several paths and one take you down to the lake and then back up. Good exercise, if you like.

This lovely park is worth a visit even if it's too misty to see Mt Fuji. The woodland walk around the whole area was so beautiful and we really enjoyed our time there. There are lots of spots for picnics en route but be sure to clean up after yourselves so more people can enjoy

We walked up to the top of the park and visited the house that used to be the Royal family's holiday resort. The way up was nice and cool in June. The building that used the Royal holiday venue had a mini exhibition of the place showing the original blueprint of the resort.

If you ask the car park attendant and show him your disability badge he will give your driver a special pass allowing your minibus to be taken to the Imperial Palace building. The traditional garden is mainly wheelchair accessible with views over Lake Ashi to Fuji. (If you’re

It is a short 10 min walk from the south shore cruise terminal of Lake Ashi (Stop #1) and the garden itself is very pretty. It has an impressive building housing a museum on the ground floor and a cafe above. We had good tea and coffee with cookies here. There are excellent

We stopped at this park on one of the ports of the sightseeing cruise of lake Ashi. This park has a few different trails to follow and is bigger than I thought, when looking at a map! We walked the waterfront trail, which I will warn is a little rocky and rough/uneven at

As one of our first site-seeing destinations using the Hakone free pass, Onshi Hakone Park was emblematic of the beauty and tranquility of Japan. The gardens and woods alone are worth a visit, but the views from the park of Lake Ashi, Mt. Fuji and the surrounding hills are

This was the palace gardens of the previous dinner residence of the imperial family. Immaculately maintained, picturesque vignettes that are Instagram worthy, and on a clear day you can see Mt Fuji. What's not to love? Admission is free.
A lovely varied gardens area with great views of the Lake and Mount Fuji (if weather permits). Located close to the Hakone Checkpoint.

We walked alot, but we did not feel tired. Before hiking to see the temples, we enjoyed watching the trees while crossing the river by a big boat. We did take alot of pictures. Very nice place with memories
Beautiful serene park to amble around. Trees ordered, magnificent views through to the lake and more. Plus a visit to the house around which the park was built.

After crossing Lake Ashi on the "pirate boat" we walked left toward this park. We walked on the trail closest to the lake. It was very foggy when we walked so we didn't enjoy many views but the trail was lush with greenery and a very serene walk. We walked toward the

Beautiful park on the Lake Ashi area, lush garden and trees. Best place to recharge and meditate and be at peace with nature. Placid water coming from the lake. Trees organically lined up along the walking path in the park. You can hear birds singing, frogs croaking sounds and

Very much enjoyed stroll in this park, beautiful well maintained grounds, amazing views from observation point even if Mount Fuji was hiding a bit. Some flowers, hydrangeas were in bloom. Stopped by the detached palace, western style modest building, the only one left from

We missed the tulips in May.. and there is nothing much of flowers in the fields while we were there. . We enjoyed the indoor display of flowers. . And disappointed with the outdoor fields. . We also missed seeing Mt. Fuji because it was cloudy for the whole day. Our

One of our group members has been to Mt Fuji seven times and only seen the mountain twice as it is often enveloped in mist. We were lucky to see the mountain in its snowy cap clearly from the viewing area nearby. The puffs of geo thermal gas were eerie as we drove up the

This detached palace park has a small mansion which is now a coffee house. The park has a good view of the lake but on the day of our visit, it was cloudy. The lake looked pretty dark and no way to see Mt. Fuji. It is a place to relax rather than sightseeing.

On lucky days views of Mt Fuji summit across Lake Ashinoko from the elevated Park viewpoint. Located on a small peninsula which juts into Lake Ashinko the park and buildings which remain served as a summer resort for the Imperial Family and guests. Construction began in 1884 and

The park is quite large, overlooking Lake Ashi. It is said that on a clear day (too cloudy on my day of visit), one can see Mt Fuji from here. I however doubt if this is the best place to admire this great mountain. There do not seem to be too many visitors. After all there are

A great place to see Mr Fuji at anytime of the day! Even if you couldn't see Mt Fuji because of the weather, the park itself is worth a visit. You will hear birds singing everywhere. It's a heavenly place. You won't get tired of the view!

This is quite a pleasant park with some nice views and some exquisitely sculptured trees. There's vending machines, rubbish bins, a small coffee shop with a few gifts, and toilets. The views of Mt Fuji can be spectacular, but you need a clear day with sunshine and plenty of

This was the closest we got to Mt Fuji during our honeymoon in the winter of January 2016. Fuji-san was partially hidden by this stubborn plume of cloud but still the surrounding waters and mountains made for a picturesque shot. Best thing is that there was no people! Great if
Visited this on the hike from Hakone-machi to Moto-Hakone. Had to climbed some stairs up, but view of Mt Fuji well worth it! (see my photo). Otherwise, nothing else really special about this park.

We wandered over to Onshi Hakone Park while in Hakone. The park does have a main building with a small restaurant, and from many points there are amazing views of Lake Ashi. Unfortunately, on a cloudy day there's no view of Mt. Fuji. We didn't feel there was much to see once

If you have time wander through the whole park, it has a stunning view back across the lake and out to Mt Fuji, although we could hardly see it due to the haze. Still nice little spot, make your way down and walk through the old Cedars on the way back into the town.

The park is between Moto-Hakone and Hakone-machi-by walk 10-15 minutes. In park is also Hakone palace. Onshi Hakone park is very nice with a lot of walking trails and with great view on lake and Fuji. Is open all the time and is free.

Having survived your pirate ship voyage, loos ashore, walk along to the Hakone checkpoint, circa 1619, where there are many interesting shops. One of these is a box maker who produces wonderful marquetry/parquetry patterns in a unique way. Also all of them have ingenious
Some of the best views of mt Fuji and the surrounding mountains and lake ashi. The park itself was underwhelming but go for the views! Plus, it's peaceful in the park to sit and relax.

If you are doing the Hakone loop, then this is worth adding in. It is an easy walk along the lakeside, and as others have mentioned gives some great views of Mount Fuji on a clear day. Our trip was in December, so I can only imagine how much more beautiful it could be with

This is an awesome park that's between the Hakone Checkpoint and the Hakone Detached Palace. There's a cedar path that brings you here and another cedar path that leads you out. Once inside the park, you can marvel at its beauty and find the spot labeled as "top 100 views of Mt.

The view from this point should be the best from lake ashino, depends on weather condition. This park is not big and it's good for morning walk, you can enjoy fresh air and natural environment. Beware of the strong wind at the top of the park. You can enjoy the full lake view.

Its just off one of the staions on the Tramway, lovely flowers and photoops. You can have a nice cup of coffee in a chalet like restaurant within the gardens, and amidst lovely flowers. Highly recommeded

Beautiful park with views of Lake Ashi and weather depending Mount Fuji!
Great views of Mount Fuji from the observation point.
Wonderful peaceful walk with great views towards Mt. Fuji

A very peaceful park in Hakone with some beautiful rose garden. It has a great view point with Lake Ashi in the front and if you’re lucky you can see Mount Fuji in the background. The Onshi-Hakone Park is just a stop away from Moto-Hakone. …

What a lovely town! It was my dream to see it and wasn't disappointed.  The cruise, cable cart and walk around Hakone was pure pleasure.
Very nice hike with both manicured and natural landscaping.
We walked for an hour on the tokaido to finally arrive there, the place is beautiful and you can do some visits while being there. We spent the whole day there and had a lot of fun!
The view point is awesome, you can take the steep path if you fancy a walk but not much to see on the way ( the trees are awesome tho )

Fantastic

Mind blowing

Out of this world..

Very very beautiful place to see...to feel...and to cherish

In Japan if you go...do visit this place

text.wiki:
Lake Ashi (芦ノ湖, Ashi-no-ko), also referred to as Hakone Lake or Ashinoko Lake, is a scenic lake in the Hakone area of Kanagawa Prefecture in Honshū, Japan. It is a crater lake that lies along the southwest wall of the caldera of Mount Hakone, a complex volcano that last erupted in 1170 CE at Ōwakudani.  The lake is known for its views of Mt. Fuji, its numerous hot springs, historical sites, and ryokan. The lake is located on the Tōkaidō road, the main link between Kyoto and Tokyo. A number of pleasure boats and ferries traverse the lake, providing scenic views for tourists and passengers. Several of the boats are inspired by the design of sailing warships.
Most visitors to Lake Ashi stay in one of the hotels or ryokan located in the area to visit some of the local attractions. There is also a campsite at the north end of the lake. Hakone Shrine is a shrine that has been visited by shōgun, samurai, and many travelers over the centuries. Large sections of the Old Tōkaidō road are preserved here. Onshi Park was the summer retreat for the imperial family that is now a public park. Taking the aerial tram Hakone Ropeway to The Great Boiling Valley.  From Togendai on Lake Ashi, the Hakone Ropeway aerial tram connects to Sounzan, the upper terminus of the Hakone Tozan Cable Car funicular railway. This in turn connects to the Hakone Tozan Line mountain railway for the descent to Odawara and a connection to Tokyo by the Tōkaidō Shinkansen.Visitors can also take the Hakone Sightseeing Cruise with its pirate ships from Togendai to Moto-Hakone Port and Hakone-Machi Port on opposite ends of the lake. The cruise line began in 1950.
The name means "lake of reeds" in Japanese: 芦 (ashi) is "reed", and 湖 (ko) is "lake". The abundance of nature makes it popular with hikers. There are many trails with different levels of challenge.

		
		
		
		
		
		


== References ==
"Hakone". Global Volcanism Program. Smithsonian Institution.

text.quote: Sightseeing cruises are offered on this scenic crater lake with a campsite & nearby hiking trails.
trip: Must visit late in Hakone/ Odawara. Set in a peaceful area of Japan, surrounded by local eatery and ice-cream parlors.

So serene cool and beautiful. Beautiful scenery amazing treasure of Japan. Beautiful serene cruises. Well worth it Simply gorgeous

This was more fun than I expected even though it was too cloudy to view Mt Fuji the lake was nice and the boat ride peaceful once the schoolchildren exited

The boat trip across lake Ashi is worth it, even if you have to brave the cold. The Hakone pass is very useful and good to travel around in Hakone.
