You have to work out your trip to see which way round you want to see all the sights and some packages do not give you the whole lake but just part of it - we done it ourselves (with the wife’s planning) and had the whole lake trip - a nice lake cruise that is so relaxing Be

There are a couple of boats that cruise around the lake and you can get off at the other side if you wish. The lake and the surrounding area are breathtaking during the various seasons, but we were too early for the cherry blossom. We took the pirate ship and the ride across was
Can take a boat across. Windy and cold so might be much better in warmer seasons. Fun restaurant at dock for lunch.
Gorgeous lake with views of Mount Fuji. Placid boat ride took us along the shore of the lake and we were able to view several towns. Watch for the duck boats. Quite a hoot!

This does look like a very popular and pretty lake – on a nice day…. When we visited it was raining, cold and dull. No chance of a sighting of mount Fuji – she is very “shy” in this weather – of which I am told there is a lot! The towns around the lake are like many across the
On a clear day you can get a very good view of the Mount Fuji and the city of Hakone. We were very fortunate to have a nice sunny day
Great for whole family. Windy during Summer season but worth to see the City of Hakone from the Lake. During Winter season, Mt Fuji are visible most of the time. Unfortunatelly not so during summer.
If you like outdoors this is a must. Walking trails and the Tori gate are a must see. There are several parks all around and temples with gardens and walking pats.

We were fortunate to visit on a perfect day. Everywhere we went we had good views of Fuji, which is special, for some reason. While the pirate boats are a bit odd they are comfortable & good for taking photos. Overall a pleasant experience.
Yes the Pirate boat is worth taking. Yes pay for first class if it is crowded. They include a nice commentary without being intrusive.
Viewing the lake was included with our Hakone FreePass. Operations end at 4:15pm so we missed it on our first day, but made it our a part of our morning agenda on the second. Great views!

I am not sure why we sailed the lake on a pirate ship but what the heck. Depending on the weather determains whether you get a glimpse of Mt Fuji. Clouds blocked the mountain on my visit. The highlight was getting some very good photos of the tori gate that is situated in the
You can approach the lake via a bus or the funicular, but don’t miss the boat ride across. The floating prayer gate is beautiful, though currently under construction/ repair.
Nice a round allot of mountain and its an amazing view and their a coffee and restaurants you can spend a good time
Nice lake with your typical type of lake tour to get a decent view of Mt. Fuji. There are many restaurants, shops and galleries nearby.
Had a lovely cruise on a gorgeous day - the views of Mt Fuji were spectacular. The water was such a deep blue and very calm. Would definitely recommend this excursion. The area is very peaceful.
Visited the lake, have a lunch there and then take the rope way. It is a beautiful place but in winter, there isn't much to see.

This is our second time visiting the lake during our trip to Hakone. Pretty and unique pirate boats , Japanese land mark Mt Fuji at the background. Must visit place if you are around in Hakone. If you have hakone pass - you can use all the transport around Hakone including
we rode the classic looking ship going to another site before taking the cable car. during the boat ride you will see mt. fuji and the famous tori.
The lake is nothing spectacular but unique in the settings of Hakone. Most travelers cross the lake to go into the ropeway.

A tourist trap unfortunately. Not much to see and if you have been on boats and lakes before, this would be quite underwhelming. If you do it from owakudani then mt fuji is behind you at the very end and is far away so it's not really worth the photo. Please be mindful the

Not a very big lake. Went on the pirate ship. Weather was pretty cold though the sun was out. To be honest, nothing much to see except you can see Mount Fuji on one part of the cruise. If you continue with the next leg, you get to see more of the volcano.
We came here in December. Thought photos and the really thing was kinda different. Maybe its Winter. Still a nice lake but definitely not a wow.

I don't think that the lake is worth the visit and the ropeway ride up to the shrine was a waste of time as it was freezing and covered in fog at the top. We did get some good views of Mount Fuji on the ride up to the peak of Hakone and the views were impressive until we were
Taking the pirate ship on this lake is a must. The surrounding of this lake is very scenic with forest and golf courses.
Incredible views and lots of good restaurants around, buy the hakone free pass so you can do the scenic cruise. Worth it for the views on a good day

We went on the boat and walked to the shrine and on the ropeway and there was no sight of mount fujiii! Ultra sad as the announcements mock you throughout the experience by saying " on the right you can now experience a beautiful view of mount Fuji!!" All we saw was fog and rain.

It’s beautiful here. We were there very early in the morning and I got an unobstructed view of Mount Fuji and the famous red tori gate. The trek to see the red tori gate and the nearby shrine took about 15 mins. Unfortunately parts of the shrine was under construction so walking

We visited Lake Ashi while on our tour with Shin of ToursbyLocals. It is so peaceful just watching the lake. Unfortunately we didn't see Mount Fuji due to clouds but on the train back from Kyoto we got a lovely view of Mount Fuji.
On a clear day, you will be able to see Mt. Fuji while riding a Japanese Pirate Ship. Enjoy the view and serene Lake Ashi.
We saw Lake Ashi when we took The Rope but did not take the boat ride. It’s a beautiful lake - very serene.

The lake is situated on top of the mountains, which is a historical volcano. One a fine day, you will be able to see mount Fuji from here. There are some shops around the boarding place for the pirate ship and they have some good foods there.
A lovely natural environment! You can visit and old cedar tree forest and a ancient temple in the hills. Afterwards just grab a ferry across the lake.
The lake has a nice view on Mt Fuji.Take the pirate boats and you will be pleasantly surprised by the experience, the views. It makes it more fun.
We had a lovely half hour cruise of Lake Ashi. The views from the boat are beautiful and it made for a lovely relaxing time in an otherwise busy day.

We took the boat cruise on Lake Ashi and it was a beautiful lake surrounded by beautiful scenery (including Mount Fuji). There are also a couple of great small-town stops along the lakefront, with nice restaurants and shops to peruse. Very relaxing experience!

The ride in the ship is quiet and serene as you are mesmerised by the beautiful "koyo" (autumn leaves) on either sides of the river. Lake Ashi is also beautiful during sunset. So would recommend one to be present at the Hakone-machi side during sunset. It is a short walk up to

I went with my wife and mother in law on the ship, i thoroughly enjoyed the scenery and the whole adventure of being on the Lake and spent a bit extra going 1st class.great views, didnt Fuji san that day due to the cloud cover but still an enjoyable day all round.
We took the boat from one side to the cable car side. You're treated to a great view with mount fuji in the background.

The boat only sails at specific times and can get quite busy so it’s best to queue up early to be sure you can get on the boat you want Most people just wander around the top deck taking photos and there are some seats at the top. On a clear day you will see Mt Fuji. The cruise
Is a nice place to stroll but too much tourist. Many shops and eatery. The pirate ships ride across the lake.
Buy the Hakone Free Pass - worth every yen. So you can go on unlimited trips on the Pirate Ships, Ropeways and Cable cars.

We took the Nankai Romance Car (reserved seating) from Shinjuku Station to Hakaone-Yumoto and then caught the Tozan bus express to Hakone-machi where we spent the night prior to taking the lake cruise. I would like to return and try fishing for trout in the lake. Boat rentals

Post-Owakudani station, our ropeway cable car took us to Togendai station. At Togendai station, one could catch the ropeway back to Owakudani, catch a bus back to Gora station (and more) or catch a boat to Hakone-Machi. We opt for the boat (admission included in our Hakone Day

This is not an easy trip if you have limited mobility despite assurances. We went to Mount Fuji, the coach parked up a good 200 yards from the centre, so we didn’t get out of the coach. Then we went for “lunch”, which was not included in our package, we knew that, but then we

We enjoyed our boat trip on a mock pirate ship as part of the cable/ropeway/rail trip in the Hakone region using the Hakone Free Pass. Nice views. We were there when clouds covered Mt. Fuji, but it was still an enjoyable visit and took us to the lovely art museum at the south
We were very lucky to be on the lake as sunset was approaching. The cloud cleared and we had a wonderful view of Mount Fuji.

Although it was a Misty Moisty Cloudy day ,we did get to take some good photos of the Red Gate and Lake Ashi .....Not much to say. Caught a slight glimpse of Mt Fuji before the clouds got in to cover the whole mountain

Like many places in Japan, the townships around the lake are tired and in need of tidyup. After arriving via the cable-car from Hakone we strolled around the port of Tokendai where the 'pirate' ships depart. By all means take the Cable Car it is a lovely trip.

There was much more space with a 500yen upgrade (400 with the Hakone pass), with indoor seating and a separate open air top deck for viewing. The 'cruise' was short and unfortunately the clouds meant we didnt see anything of Fuju san but the views must be amazing on a clear day.
This is part of the Hakone loop and is really beautiful. Too cloudy for Mount Fuji but still worth doing, as the scenery is lovely. Do the boat trip across then walk round the lake to the shrine.

Although distance from either Shinjuku or Tokyo Station by train is a bit far (Around 2.5 to 3 hours), where you have to change train twice and again change to Hakone Ropeway (Cable Car), the trip is worth going. Our family have reached Togendai Station right at the shore of

The bus service runs very regularly to Lake Ashi where the 'pirate ship' takes you across the lake to the ropeways which take you higher up the hillside. We were fortunate to get a glimpse of Mount Fuji during the crossing but were later rewarded with an even better view at the

Lake Ashi itself is lovely. A caldera lake (elevation 723metres above mean sea level), it is surrounded by steep mountains that are thickly wooded. The air is fresh and cool. The brochures say that Mt Fuji should be visible (in the northwest direction) from the southern shore.
sail across on the boat for breathtaking scenary all free if you have purchased the Hakone free pass, resturant at the harbour excellent choice of food if the boat isnt in
The boat trip, walk through the cedars. Also the check point all very interesting. Everyone is so very friendly. Loved the play. Just walk and enjoy.

We visited Hakone using the Hakone free pass which covered the train ride from Odawara station to Hakone-Yumoto station, the Tozen cable car, ropeway, buses and sailing ship on Lake Ashi. From Tokyo to Odawara, we used the JR pass on JR trains. We took a sightseeing cruize on
Definitely worth trying out the pirate ship. A bit cliche, but overall interesting experience and different view of Lake Ashi.

We took a return boat journey on Lake Ashi. The boats operating the trips are very atmospheric and the views across the lake, the woodland and the magnificent properties along the lake’s shore make for a relaxing trip.

We hiked from Hakone to the lake. Duration there and back: 3h way up and 2h way down. The first hour up is on the road so not very enjoyable with the high way over you. However, once you reach the old paved Tokaido road, it is a nice forest walk, you go through a river, very
The lake is very pretty, there are not many buildings around it and nature prevails. Some vacation homes seem to have been built into the surrounding woods to keep the shoreline free.
Took the boat from the MotoHakone to the Togendai Port. The boat ride is free with the Hakone Pass and it was nice ride across Lake Ashi.

We bought the Hakone discount pass for 3 days the equivalent of $65 nz approx. This gave you unlimited trips on bus, ropeway ,cable car the pirate ship on Lake Ashi. Nice walk around the waterfront in old palace grounds and cedar tree walk to shrine. Fun boat trip!
Great views from the Motohakone-Ko part of the lake. There’s not much to see in the ferry to the other end but it does take you to the ropeway where you get more great views.

Gorgeous lake with plenty of attractions surrounding it. Hakone Shrine is the perfect place to snap good photos capturing the area’s beauty. It wasn’t terribly crowded when we were there, but it can get a bit chaotic at Motohakone - where the sightseeing cruise takes off from .

The boat ride across Lake Ashi is a lovely experience. We caught the second ferry of the morning (large pirate like ship) and it wasn't overly crowded. The water was calm and the scenery was beautiful. When you board make your way up to the top level for optimal views and to

Great tour if you plan to do the cable car in hakone. The boat makes a few stops that allow you to get off and get back on. The best option if you plan to do the cable car the the lake ashi tour make sure you order the combination deal that they have. You should order this when

The Lake Ashi cruise should not be missed if you have the 72 hour Hakone Free Pass. I definitely got more than what I paid for when I did the whole Hakone Tozan Train-Ropeway-Gondola-Pirate Ship Cruise (to and from Togendai). It was fun. (I love lakes!) I do however want to
We purchased the Hakone 72-hour pass which include the cable car, ropeway, and Pirate Boat around the Lake. It was well worth it and very unusual.

We rode on "Pirates Boat" to enjoy this beautiful lake. The lake water was clear and clean. The air mountain also very fresh, and of course the scenery was amazing. If you like photography, then you must visit this place to take as much as possible the beautiful scenery.

Such a beautiful spot. We walked round the lake to the shrine, used the opportunity to take many wonderful photos. Almost impossible to take a bad one. The shops are close, plus food available from several outlets. Visit the historic Change Station and walk through the forest.

A large and beautiful inland lake assertions which many of Hakone's tourist attractions are dotted. The Hakone Checkpoint, Motohakone, the summer palace gardens, and too many restaurants, souvenir shops and hotels to count.

I went with a tour group and it wasn't on your list but it was great to see a lake. It was a wonderful fine day and you can see it was clear blue water and no wind. I would go again as I like seeing it and would like to spend more time there. We went on a cruise which wasn't
Nice scenery, volcanic lake, big enough for a nice boat ride. It was a bit chilly to stay on deck and the visibility from the inside is limited. Disappointed in the boat but not the lake.

We rode on one of the “pirate” boats. It wasn’t a long ride but a pleasant trip. There’s a small snack bar and you can sit inside if it’s chilly. The shores are mostly forested but there are a couple Shinto shrines that you pass.
We always have enjoyed this lake. You can walk along the lake into the woods and relax or you can take the boat across and enjoy the view.

This is a beautiful lake. We bought all inclusive tickets which allowed us to take the bus to the lake, go on the boats, rope car, cable car and local trains back to Yugawara. The tickets cost 4,000 yen each, which I think was extremely cheap for what we were able to
We spent the day here. Beautiful place with stunning views. A great boat ride and little villages. Loved it and will miss it

Big lake surrounded by mountains. Can do cruise on a pirate ship either a one way to Motohakone or return (included in Hakone Free Pass) Paddle boats (shaped like swans) available too. Restaurant at lake.
There is so much to see here and many different types of cruises that you can do. I think that it would have been better to stay in the area rather than travel to and from in a single day.
I repeat even under rain and with no view on Mont Fuji this place style to be magical The mountain, volcano lake is so peaceful There is nice walk to do around and on it just enjoy the nature scenery

After taking the ropeway from Gora, you arrive at lake Ashi. You can take a bus or a cruise to return to the civilization. We took the cruise cause we wanted to see the red shire of lake Ashi but we didn't. But we had a superb view of Mt Fuji and we bought a lot of cool stuff at
Offers a great view of Fuji in the colder months and has a beautiful sightseeing cruise that's included with the Hakone pass

We sailed from the Northern part to the southern part of the lake with the pirate ship cruise. We were there early morning, the sun was shining and Mount Fuji was visible. Shortly after we reached the other shore the mountain disappeared behind clouds for the rest of the day.
No Mt. Fuji sighting but with the clouds hanging low among the mountains, the view was romantic and mysterious.

We have visited Lake Ashi on a sunny day in April. There was a strong wind what made it quite cold. The lake is beautiful and from a few spots you can see Mount Fuji. Around the lake there are a few restaurants and shops. The bakery is good and haves a nice view on the lake.

Taking the galley cruise ships across Lake Ashi is part of the Hakone circuit and gives a welcome pause or breather to day trip visitors who have been chasing a tight schedule getting from one attraction to another.

Definitely recommend the sightseeing boat across the lake. It was rainy and foggy when we visited, so no Mt Fuji sighting, but still worth it. The mountains and water looked beautiful and haunting with all the fog. The boat has some narration (not a ton) noting landmarks in

Lake Ashi or AshinoKo is a lake in Hakone area of Kanagawa Prefecture. It is a crater lake formed by a volcanic eruption. There are beautiful views of Mount Fuji from the shores of the lake on a clear day. There are many cruises on the lake throughout the day operated across the

We rode a pirate ship which is super cool. It was very cold at the time so it was super freezing especially with the breeze but the view is just amazing! I WOULD STRONGLY recommend this. Kids would love it too.

We were brought to the boat terminal and rode a boat that cruised along the lake. Some people stayed indoors, while some of us went up to the open roof deck which provided a great 360 degree view. As with boat cruises, it is a time to relax. This is a one way boat trip as at
Pick the sightseeing cruise, for a lake view of the Torii gate and the Mt. Fuji. Walk from the entrance till the shrine and take a photo at the Torii

This lake is absolutely stunning. If you are going in July, you will likely still not see Mt. Fuji, but it doesn't make it any less beautiful! Try to go during sunset! The Hakone Shrine is also right near here. You can get here via the Hakone Free Pass that includes a
Enjoyable boat trip- actually couldn't see Mt Fuji but nice nonetheless. Boats are large replicas of old ships so a fun experience

We took a cruise across to the cable cars on Lake Ashi, spectacular views and scenery, you dont feel like you are in Japan more like Europe, we enjoyed the water views and glad we chose to cruise across to otherside of the lake to catch a cable car.
Make sure to get out on a boat on the lake, you might even get a lovely view of Mt Fuji! A must do in Hakone.

I love this place. It's beatiful in nature and views. Thereare a lot of tourists, which I am not abigfan of... We bought the 2 days pass for 4000 yen (Hakone Free Pass) at Odawara Station, which includes buses, ships, cable car, ropeway, and reductions. Beautiful daytrip

The lake itself is nothing special in my opinion. What is really nice to see is the Mount Fuji, however make sure you visit the lake on a clear day otherwise your visit here is not worth it. We took the cable car to the lake then the boat to Hakone moto where we found an amazing

Wonderful lake. It is something special. It is possible also to make a little cruise on a pirate boat an see many different places in few minutes. Unfortunately wasn't impossible to me to see the Fuji san but I appreciate it anyway
Really nice day trip in Hakone. Really recommend on going on a not cloudy day so you can see mt. Fuji .
Enjoyed the cruise across the lake. It was a bit over cast, so we weren’t able to see Fuji, but still worth the trip for the beautiful scenery.

Amazing views, Check. Incredible Hotels, check. Museums, definitely must see. Experience 100% recommended. One of the most beautiful landscape towns we got to see in our visit to this amazing country.

Lake Ashi is so beautiful with Mount Fuji located in the background. We stayed at Prince hotel, Hakone and had some of the best views if Lake ashi. Sunrise and sunset are just so perfect looking at mt Fuji and lake ashi.

We came on a not so clear day, but the lake was the most beautiful part of the round trip excursion in Hakone. On a clear day, the views of Fuji must be spectacular and brilliant. On a not so clear day, the lake itself is a treasure. Worth the visit.

We did a quick trip in the morning because stormy weather forecast early afternoon. Were still caught in passing showers and wind strong enough to blow away umbrella. Hakone Shrine, Hakone Checkpoint and park are nice places to walk around. There are walking trails along the
Beautiful here. Don’t forget to buy the Hakone pass well in advance as it is entirely worth it to use cable cars, bus, local trains, ropeway, and cruise.

Great area, the gondola ride over the crater was wonderful, the sulfur smell is quite strong, then the gondola ride to the lake side was beautiful, then boarded the pirate ship to the other side of the lake
Amazing site, you feel so closed from nature. The mix for color of the lake and the vegetation are amazing and the few spots where you can see Mont Fuji make an incredible experience.
Mt Fuji in the distance, dense greenery, quiet peace and a brilliant blue lake.... lovely! It was raining when we visited, and it assumed a poignancy of its own - romantic and reclusive.

The journey was the point, antique train, then cable car, then gondola were all fun with amazing views. We went over a smoking volcanic area on the gondola and were graced by a brief view of "shy" Mt Fuji. Thrilling. Didn't take the boat across the lake as we got there too late.
The lake was nice. We rode a boat across the lake (the line was a bit long). The air was cool in the summer, due to the altitude.
Majestical feeling & views, we came from Kyoto but it was worth the trip You can fill a day here possibly 2 or 3

We took a ride around the lake with the pirate ship. The kids are loving it. The ship is big enough that we don't feel too crowded. If you want to get to the front of the ship (and pose like in Titanic) and have a photo spot for yourself, you might want to take the VIP class
We almost skipped going to the lake because we were short on time, only having stopped overnight in Hakone briefly. So glad we didn’t!! It is beautiful!
Great for whole family. Windy during Summer season but worth to see the City of Hakone from the Lake.

Nice views sometimes but if clouds roll in not much to see. Pleasant boat ride but ours was a bit short. The lake is dotted with fake tourist old style Japanese sailing ships. Homie duck paddle boats. Experience is nice and you may get a view of the mountain but mostly

I had read very good reviews about the boat ride across the lake. Unfortunately for us, it was raining. The trip was not pleasant, and there were no views of Mt. Fuji. Not the fault of anyone but just bad luck for us. Maybe next time .....

I always love to cruise, and this was wonderful except for the roaring wind. The sky was clear and the view of Mt. Fuji was spectacular. Lake Ash is a wonderful lake with lots of interesting history. The tour director on the boat told us stories, fables, myths, and history

Our tour took the ropeway down to the lake and then walked to the boat dock. The cruise ship was a catamaran with bleacher seats on the ramp up to the top deck. Unfortunately it was hazy so we could only get hints of Mount Fuji from time to time. In my experience these kind of
We took a boat ride on Lake Ashi! It is very calm and smooth ride. There are beautiful views all around!

As part of the sightseeing route in Hakone, you can take the ferry ride from Hakonemachi-lo or Motohakone-ko to cross Lake Ashi to Togendai-ko. Enjoy the scenery and cooling ride while on the ferry crossing the lake.
Wonderful boat ride across the lake. Check out the Buddha's nearby. Mt. Fuji views and one of the highlights of our trip.
Beautiful lake in the Hakone region, highly recommend taking the boat tour. On a good day you can see Mt Fuji, shops and restaurants around the lake are charming and worth a leisurely stroll
Never felt so close to nature. So beautiful and well kept place, good weekend getaway with kidz. Must visit.

We have found a good idea to plan 2 days in Hakone before moving from Tokyo to Kyoto and it turned out to be a great idea. Biught the hakone pass, for 5k yen and treveled with the ropeway, enjoyed the boat ride, and toured on the side of Lake Ashi. Can only recommend!

Cruise is beautiful and the journey took about 30mins. I took the cruise at Togendai-Ko to HakoneMachi-ko. The cruise is like a pirate ship with lower internal deck and upper open air deck. If you want fresh air, It would be nice to be on the upper deck but seats are limited.
Most scenic place. The snow peaked Mt Fuji looks like a wonder of the world. Worth staying in this area for a couple of days to relax in peace.

Did a cruise across the lake on a pirate ship it was very cold when we did this cruise and too much cloud on the mountain to see it, but ok and fun got dropped off at the other side go the lake would recommend if you have time

This is a magical place, without knowing to much about the Shintoism you can fill the spirit and harmony between mother nature and men. Beautiful landscapes and peacefull environment will let you escape from reality and feel the connection and purpose of the creation, is a must

We enjoyed the quiet location as we stayed overnight beside the lake. By around 5pm all the day trippers had disappeared and we had the area around the lakeside to ourselves. Also a good view of Mt Fuji although we got much closer views during our drive into the Japanese alps

We were rushed onto a boat for a 15 minute tour of the lake with no explanation of what we were seeing. I thought it was more interesting watching the carp beside the dock while waiting to get onto the boat, This boat took us to the ropeway which was the next part of our tour,

The lake is not huge, but it is in a nice setting--very forested (deep greer) and "civilization" is only at the two ends of the lake. There is a boat ride available that is on a "funky" modern pirate ship that the Japanese refer to as a "Viking ship" for no apparent reason!

We had lunch at the bakery overlooking the lake and then used our all day pass (well worth the 4000 yen) to board the pirate boat for a trip to the other end of the lake. The boat is well designed with plenty of space on the upper decks to get photos but also plenty of seating

The lake is beautiful surrounded by green trees. It is really a pleasant place. The buildings at the ferry are just like European style. The journey of taking the pirate ship was very good! You can even see the Mount Fuji during nice weather.
This is a nice, pretty make, with some pleasant walking. However, much of the walk along the east side of the river is along quite unpleasant roads which can get very busy.
Lake is just like you see in the brochure books. Lovely and easy trip across the lake and so beautiful. Love the experience

We went for a cruise on Lake Ashi in one of the pirate ships. It was a sunny day and the lake was calm. There are beautiful views across the lake and the surrounding hills. It was a lovely experience.
It’s a lake with a backdrop of Mount Fiji. There are fishermen dotted around...lots of trees to the waters edge and you can take a 50 minute trip on a fake galleon...it’s okay.

We were very lucky that we saw Mount Fuji on our first day when we walk around the lake on our first day in Hakone. It was simply beautiful. The Hakone sightseeing boat ( or pirate boat as it is in Japanese) takes you cross the lake within 30 minutes, the fare is included in
Taking the sightseeing cruise across Lake Ashi, it's a great way to see Mt. Fuji. Really enjoy the trip.

The Lake Ashi is enormous and it was such an amazing experience to be on a large 'French Ship' and cruising down the lake surrounded by amazing snow covered mountains. Its a MUST DO when you are here.
Relaxing 25 minute traverse of the lake from end to end, with phone ops along the way, including the famous Mount Fuji, if the clouds allow. Part of the Hakone Loop.
The boat ride across the lake was pleasant. Nothing special. The boat was crowded and we waiting quite a while before boarding.

Enjoyed a cruise on Lake Ashi. The surrounding views were so beautiful. Kudos to the Japanese, they preserve their nature and its clean everywhere. The development around the Lake is controlled and everything worked like clockwork. Lake Toba in Indonesia is bigger but is

We expected to get Fuji view from a boat on the Lake Ashi (that what people said), unfortunately we didn't get it. Just imagine how nice it would be if the sky wasn't cloudy. so, make sure you come along to this site to the same purpose when the sky is clear enough. Better to go
Walked alongside the lake and took a boot back.Very good and nice view of mount Fuiji. Wortwhile a visit! Had a good Lunch at bakery and seats with stunning views

We took a water taxi on Lake Ashi to the Hakone Hotel. The boat was a supposed to be a galleon, but was a bit of fun really! The views were less than exciting because a heavy mist descended over the lake and swathed everything to the extent that we could see very little. I am
good day at lake ashi, everything look so serene and beautiful. We went in april, and the fog made it even prettier
We took the Pirate ship (why?) across Lake Ashi and enjoyed the many views of the hills and Mount Fuji.

Visiting Lake Ashi is not about thrills or history, really even; but it is about natural beauty and quiet - both things in fairly short supply on a busy trip. The weather matters a little. It can be quite misty up the mountain, but pleasant on the water. I have only Fuji once,
This small placid lake also gives views of Mt Fuji from a distance. A calm twenty minute boat ride offerd a relaxing break.
If one visits Hakone, Lake Ashi is a must visit place, very scenic and lively to walk around with lot of shopping opportunities.
The scenery is fantastic and relaxing as we were on the Viking styled ship we could see the top of mountain Fuji with the snow covering

It was a glorious sunny day when we came here and Lake Ashi sparkled in the sunlight. You can do a sightseeing cruise across Lake Ashi with the Hakone Free Pass. This is a nice way to see the lake from different angles and also to spot Mount Fuji off in the distance.

Took a day round trip with Fuji Hakone Pass - Kawaguchiko to Gotemba (Bus), to Togendai (bus route W), to Hakone Machi port (pirate cruise), to MotoHakone via Cedar Avenue (on foot), to Kowakidani Station (Bus H), to Gora (via Hakone Tozan Rail), to Souzan, Owakudani (Ropeway)
It is a relaxing and stunning spot to spend some quiet time. The wind was heavy and we could not go on the boat ride though

The view is just amazing. You can sit and relax while admiring the view or you can hike going to the nearby shrine. We went to this place as part of our Hakone Free Pass. You’ll see people fishing or sit having coffee. It’s a good way to take in the wonderful view and just take
Weather did not favor us during our Hakone stay. We took the Hakone circuit on a very rainy day and that meant that the views during the boat ride were non-existent. A pity!

We were on the boat for approx 15 mins. It was a sunny day but quite chilly so standing on the deck was not pleasurable. There were too many people on the boat and it was difficult to see out of the windows. There was a commentary but no-one could hear it.
We went on a 30 mins boat ride, it was really nice to see mt Fuji from a different angle. It was lovely to see some cherry blossoms from the boat as well, the views were amazing.

Unfortunately when we were here it was foggy, damp and a little miserable so no sightings of the elusive Mt Fuji, but I can imagine it’s quite beautiful when the weather is good. Our guide stated that you would be very lucky to get good clear views so have low expectations and

A cruise from Hakone Machi Kou to Togendai in a large vessel. Go for the first class if you want the best views. In Togendai get on the Ropeway for a 28 minute ride to Sounzan for spectacular views of Mount Fuji.
Lovely views along the way. Comfortable and well arranged. Was a little crowded. But still worth it to do the round trip.

Whilst staying in Tokyo, Hakone was a great day trip out of the city. We were fortunate enough to go on a clear day so we had some great views of Mount Fuji. If Not a clear day you may be disappointed as I don’t think our day trip would have been as enjoyable if we couldn’t see
Came to Lake Ashi on a beautiful sunny day. Arrived to board a nice pirate boat ride. On the boat we seen beautiful picturesque views of water and mountains .

On a beautiful day this is a must do. Buy tickets to ride a boat across the lake and enjoy the scenery. On a clear day you can get some great shots of Mt. Fuji. Theirs shops and exhibits along the lake shores so you could make a day of it.
Love the lake. Boat for leisure as well as small paddle boats to enjoy the lake. Very nice pathways next to the lake. Nice for relaxing with family and friends
Lake Ashi is a volcano crater lake and has black sand beaches. Even though it was windy, the lake was calm and smooth sailing. Great wAy to spend 40 minutes. Great for photographers.

As quite a random attraction in a mountain lake in Japan, the pirate ship cruises prove a fun way to cross the lake, on a clear day the views of Fuji are quite spectacular, and the pirate ship is fun, particularly for children. It's a long trip from Tokyo for just this, so make
The view is not particularly stunning unless it is a clear sunny day and you can see mount Fuji. Anyway, it is a comfortable ride. Worth trying.
Really gorgeous trip on the pirate ship like boat. Get the free pass so it’s cheaper. Not a lot to look at on the way but a relaxing time.
We took the cruise around Lake Ashi what a beautiful view of the lake and the mountains surrounds it was cold unfortunately but we still enjoyed the view from inside.

Nice trip, a day well spent. Unfortunately the time of year was unlucky, the vegetation was mainly still dormant from winter. We took a trip on the cruise, which was also nice, but not truely special. Worth for the day, but no WOW.

We really enjoyed this day ... the train ride in the way was a little squishy but worth the cable car ride, views of Mt Fuji and beautiful boat cruise. The Hakone Free pass was excellent value and we were lucky enough to be there on a clear spring day, so the views were

We did the full route from Gora over the ropeway and down to Lake Ashi. Both definitely recommended. Views were amazing (you need it to be a clear day to see Fuji) Can recommend Hakone Tent as a place to stay right by Gora Station and traditional Japanese style!

A must do in Hakone, it takes you from Togendai to the other side where Hakone Shrine and all the other touristy spots including to the longest rope bridge in Japan.. The cruise ship has a guide, it’s mostly crowded though but is a nice experience.. If you are purchasing the

The village on the lake is so pretty and with an amazing view of Mount Fuji in the background. You can sit in the café and enjoy a cup of tea or coffee while looking at the iconic mountain in the background.

We were there on a tour--day trip to Mt Fuji and Lake Ashi and bullet train. SO owrth the trip as Lake Ashi is absolutely gorgeous! Take the gondola up to the top of the mountain and the views are unbelievable!
We enjoyed it! Took a fun boat and experience the other size with amazing food and a view. I would recommend visiting if you have time.
The boat was a lovely activity. Pay the little extra and get nice seats in first class (or you can buy the ticket on the boat)

We had high expectations of this area - but it turns out that the only great part was the fabulous view of Mt Fuji once you've crossed the Lake to the other side. Maybe it was because we were off-season, but we found the area under-developed in terms of signage (very little in

We took the Romancecar from Shinjuku, Tokyo which took 80 minutes to get to Hakone and then the Mountain Railway and cable car over sulphur springs and down to the lake. All booked at the Odakyu travel desk in Shinjuku station and not expensive (one pass covers all). The lake is
Loved the ambience. The pirate cruise and the view of mt.Fuji was amazing.. the mountain is a little far though but had breathtaking views

It's definitely worth taking one of the cruises across Lake Ashi. The views are lovely, especially if you get to see Mt Fuji. It can very get cold and windy during winter though, but we braved it anyway to stand on the open air deck.

Taking bus opposite Hakone-Yumoto using Hakone Free Pass will bring you to Motohakone. There you will see the beautiful Lake Ashi. You will need to walk a while to see the famous Torii Gate that sits in the lake. I visited the lake in mid Dec, the weather is cooling and scenery

A wonderful place to experience, the landscape surrounding Lake Ashi is naturally gorgeous. Provided you have the Hakone Free Pass, I highly recommend taking the ship across the lake, then taking a stroll along the edge, to the park and shrines. Considering I was there in

We traveled from Tokyo to Hakone hoping to see My. Fuji. Unfortunately, we didn't that day but Lake Ashi at sunset was still absolutely beautiful. I'll never forget that view of the lighted up tori gate on the lake.
This is a gorgeous lake and you can take a cruise on a "pirate ship" too. If the weather is kind and the surroundings are clear, you may catch a glimpse of Mt. Fuji in the distance.

We took the pirate ship like how tourists are supposed to do it... I must say, the ship does look a bit cheesy. Ride was all, but didn't have a good seat so no good views. I didn't see Fuji San at all.

Obviously a view one has to see, when visiting Japan. The Majestic Fuji San peeking in over surrounding hills on lake Ashi. In a way a pity the experience is so sterile. I do not want any noisy on-lake activities but some nice terraced cafe's , taverne's, would be nice. The
Honestly invest in the pass, it is well worth your money. You get so much out of it, and the surroundings become so much easier to move around if you have it!

Togendai is the Lake Ashi stop where you can use your Hakone Free Pass to ride the pirate ship to get to the other side of the lake. You can sit inside the ship's cabin or stay outside on deck (which is cold & windy). The ride is about 45 mins long. The ship stops at 2 ports.
It was sunny and cold on my visited day. Perfect weather to see Mount Fuji from the lake. Remember that all the activities stop before 4pm. Better to come here early.

A must see lake in Hakone Valley. Be sure to stop by the Hakone Shrine to see the tori gate along the lake that's in all the photos. Motohakone on the south end of the lake has some nice restaurants and cafes.

I've always wanted to go to Japan and finally, this lifelong dream came true last year. I was not disappointed and true enough, Japan is one the best places I've been to. And the highlight of my trip was the visit to Lake Ashi, as part of our Mt. Fuji adventure. As a nature
Awsome place to see . Start early to visit all the attractions and enjoy the view. It closes early during autmn.

The lake cruise was really a great experience for me, my wife and 10 year old son when we visited Japan last year. This tour was part of the Mt Fuji and the Cable car ride tour. You will ride a pirate ship on this lake cruise and the views are really very beautiful. During our

DEC 31 2017 Mt Fuji Day Trip: Pirate Ship of Lake Ashi, Mt Fuji 5th Station and Gotemba Premium Outlets ... We booked this tour through Viator and were very upset with the outcome. The day was cloudy which meant our itinerary changed. This tour was just a shopping centre trip.
The entire Lake Ashi area is stunning. We were there as fall weather was rolling in and we still loved it.

take the ride to enjoy the scenery offered by the lake. the ride was around 25 mins (one-way), which was sufficient. the ride at the same time did a favor on transporting you to another location. best deal is to get the hakone pass for this too. there was option to upgrade to
We visited on a rainy day and couldn't see much. We also didn't know about the Hakone pass, meaning that when everything is put together it's a really expensive few days!
Must of been the same day we went to Hakone Ropeway, we did this afterwards although I don't remember where we were going.
A beautiful area in which to wander (get the travel pass for use on buses, boats, ropeway and trains together with the clear and clever area map).

Taking a sight-seeing cruise on a pirate ship is good fun. If you have bought the Hakone FreePass, the cruise is included. However, it is recommended to upgrade to VIP cabin with a small fees at the cruise ticket counter as you do not have to fight for a seat and view with other

This was really a fun experience. Once you get off the boat at the first stop you can see Mt Fuji and then we walked around the lake to the next port where there was an even better view!! Lots of good soba restaurants, shops and 711 of course. Easy to get back to Gora from
It was sad that i visited on a rainly day, the lake would be beautiful if it was sunny day, i cant see much scene or mountain fuji. There were serveral restaurants around.

Some parts are commercialised for tourists ... a bit too much. Museum, aquarium, shrine, temple, park, cafe and restaurant. Crowded. If you visit some remote areas, you can find less crowded, nature rich and peaceful places. I prefer those places.
So many restaurants (especially soba) and cafe, so small my stomach! Many attractions around the lake too with the famous pirate ship, cruise and the Hakone Shrine Torii being the basic.

A picturesque mountainside village with a beautiful lake. You'd be able to see mt Fuji with a short ferry ride out on the lake, depending on the weather. The main attraction would be the shrine/temple which would take about a 15minute walk from the bus station. About

Lake Ashi was beautiful and peaceful. Also if you walk towards the left, you will be able to glance Mt Fuji on a clear day. I didn't take the pirate ship because it seem really commercialized as hordes of tourists are dropped by their agencies to board the ship. However, do take

You spot the lake whilst descending on the Ropeway. The terminal is well setup with a cafe in a souvenir shop and toilets. The boats are quite dramatic looking and cater for seated and standing passengers. The windows offer good photographing opportunities. The weather was
we took a cable car to hakone machi and then from there visited lake ashinoko in the famous pirate cruise ship.
Beautiful boat cruise on a private ship. Perfect views of Mt Fuji and pulling into the small villages in the evening is magical. My husband's favourite part of the trip. Would recommend thoroughly.
Strongly recommend as it is a very beatiful and relaxing trip. We did not know there were 2 piers with 2 different types of boat to cruise in Lake Ashi. But we really love the one we took.
Try the cruise and upgrade to the vip captain dock with extra 400¥ you’ll have nice picture and free space to take from whatever angle you wish The lake very beautiful near the sunset
Very nice boat ride and great views specially of MT Fuji.Peaceful villages on the shores and some nice reataurants.
Easy to reach with the local bus service (a three day pass is recommended). The lake offers a great view of Mount Fuji with the autumn colors as background. Wow !!!

Of coarse it's a touristic must . Like all other attractions around the Hakone region . All you have to hope for is a clear , not too cold day , and not loads of tourists around you , and I promise you will have a great hour crossing this scenic Ashi Lake with the Pirate Ship
Visited the lake and Hakone Shrine together. Didnt get to see Mt Fuji as it was slightly foggy but the lake was huge!

The whole experience of cruising the pirate ship along serene Lake Ashi was to view the beautiful landscape of winter season coming. The only setback was the heavy fog couldn't allow us to take much picture and the cold wind blowing thru you on the top deck was a cold cold
Pirate boat ride was interesting but quite crowded and very cold! It was worth it to get the views of the surrounding area from out on the lake.
wonderful place with a great view of mount fuji. make sure you visit the bottom of the lake where the hakone shrine resides and then walk across to the pier where you can see mount fuji
Beautiful lake trip with autumn colours and with Fuji in the background. Worth paying for first class ticket to get away from the crowd.

We were lucky as the weather was clear but the view over Mount Fuji was something I will remember forever! Breathtaking! We took the full round with the ferry which I definitely recommend as the views reach its maximum beauty on the last two circuits (we started at Tongendai)!
My wife and I took a boat cruise on the lake to enjoy the beautiful scenery and to get to the Mount Komagatake Ropeway Tram to go up the hill for more scenery.

This lake is surrounded by lush green mountains We took a cruise for around 40 minutes that was simply beautiful. Unfortunately it was cloudy and we just could imagine the pristine views this lake would offer in sunshine ,Not to be missed.

Lovely lake which on a sunny day would provide a good view of Mt Fuji, the rope/cable cars, the shrines/temples & gates around the lake, and the lake activity (boats, fisherman, tourist boats). Unfortunately we didn't great weather, so the lake wasn't kind to us. Good aerial
The weather wasn’t good when we visited this area, but I can image it to be stunning on a sunny day. The novelty pirate ferry trips on the lake are great for kids.

I would say that this lake is so picturesque! The speed of the ferry really helps you in enjoying the view and just takes you to lalaland!😄 Although Mt. Fuji didn't show its majestic cone on my visit, the view of the Tori from the ferry was enough to have kept me at awe!

If this is the first lake I've seen in Japan, I can only imagine the other lakes I have yet to see. Such a beautiful setting and a fitting way to experience the lake was to ride a pirate ship..I'd definitely want to explore more of Hakonemachi when I return to Japan.
Enjoyed our time around Lake Ashi. Very pretty with the Autumn colours. Used all modes of transport on & around the lake

During a recent visit to Japan, we took a boat ride on Lake Ashi as part of a tour. The lake was lovely and the views quite pleasant even though cloud shrouded Mount Fuji. What was hard to understand was the boat theme: 17th century British three masted sailing vessel with a

We crossed the lake using our hakone passes to use the rope way etc as part of a day trip. On a clear day which we had you can get some good views/photos of Mount Fuji, on the way back in the evening we could not even see the shore as the mist came in, it's pot luck on the

We took the Pirate ship cruise to see the sights of the lake. It was beautiful seeing the the landscape, the shrines and all the smaller mountains of the area. You can use the Hakone Free pass to travel on the lake. Unfortunately a mist was setting in so was unable to see Mount

Well worth a visit stunning autumn colour. Also some nice restaurants, coffee shops around the lake. There’s boat trips on the lake as well. There’s also a lovely art museum nearby as well that has beautiful modern Japanese art. It feels a bit like the Lake District in England.

We cruised across the lake on the "pirate" boat, which was comfortable with free wifi. The lake and surrounding forest with shrine and other structures were pretty, plus we could see Mt. Fuji shrouded in clouds.

Lake Ashinoko is breathtaking! We found the trip from Tokyo a bit difficult and lengthy though and it’s more of a relaxing area so if you’re after a bit more action I would only stay here for one to two days....very nice change though from a busy trip to Japan
We take the pirate ship cruise. Perhaps I have high expectations of the scenery so I am a bit disappointed. We can’t see the Fujiyama from the boat ride.

If you are blessed with beautiful weather, your cruise on Lake Ashi will be amazing. We were fortunate enough to take a short cruise on a cloudless, blue-sky day, and thoroughly enjoyed the serene surroundings. Mount Fuji was not very clearly in view during our cruise, but we

Oct 4 From Owaku-dani Valley we then took the Hakone Ropeway for a 30" ride before ending at Togendai on the shore of Lake Ashi. Even before we can admire the lake, we are directed to a line for purchasing tickets on the "pirate" ship that crosses the lake. The lake is truly
The scenery was beautiful although limited due to the clouds and rain. As the boat looks like a pirate boat children might enjoy the ride.The ride was smooth and it was easy to get on and off.
We took the ferry and enjoyed the scenic view of the lake. It is worth taking the trip to have a tranquil cruise and enjoy the beautiful view of the lake and Mount Fuji.

A really enjoyable cruise on the pirate ship on Lake Ashinoko. It’s amazing to think this body of water was formed after a volcanic eruption that occurred more than 3000 years ago! The cruise is very relaxing and tranquil and definitely good worth doing. Like most transport

There are 3 different cruise boats in Lake Ashi and we managed to try 2 of them (Victory and Wasa). There is quite a bit of history around this lake and you can hear some of the synopsis while cruising on the boat. Just so pleasant to stop and visit the nearby places and then
Hop on one of the lake’s cruise boats to enjoy the lovely setting and hop off to explore several small villages. A great way to spend an afternoon.

After a disappointing no show Mt Fuji, it was a relieved to see that the cruise along Lake Ashi went ahead with no clouds and mountains along the side were lush green and beautiful (we went late September). It was a short (15 minute) cruise to get to the ropeway. Be sure to go

A good visit to the lake and its surrounding environment. The weather although is always raining but it didn't dampen our interest to visit the lake. There were many visitors when I was visiting there.The air was cool and the scenary of the place is really nice and peaceful
Took a three stop boat ride which was very pleasant with helpful crew. You can choose to stay on the boat or get off and board again in during their next stop. Recommended.

Unfortunately we still didn't see the top of Mt Fuji but The Jolly Roger is an excellent trip in beautiful peaceful surroundings. We had been up to the crater top on Mt Kamiyama and descended by cable car, then went aboard what looked like a fantastic pirate ship out of Pirates

Very peaceful lake with ferries and supposedly great view of Mount Fuji. Unfortunately, the weather wasn't kind to us and the view was just of clouds - and more clouds / fog. Regardless, it is a peaceful tour and well worth the visit for families with kids.

We've spent a few days in hakone and had saved the lake for the really sunny day - to really make the most of it. In all honesty it wasn't quite what we expected. It was entirely pleasant - the pirate ship, a stroll around motohakone, etc. - but it was all very quiet and smaller

I enjoyed the cruise around Lake Ashi, after taking the ropeway over the mountains. It is a pretty lake & a nice way to view Mt Fuji (if the weather is kind to you, as it is often partially or mostly covered by cloud). If I had more time, I'm sure stopping to visit the shrine

We used the unusual Pirate boat to cross the lake to the Hakone Rope-way, which gave great views across the Lake. We also walked along the shore as well as visited several small parks. Very well worth the visit.
Great journey on the lake with super views. On a good day you get a view of Mount Fuji too! We were lucky and clouds dispersed giving a super views.
If you want the iconic photo of Fuji and the tori gate with the lake as a backdrop, you can't miss taking the ferry across the lake. From there take the rope way up to owakudani.

We were staying in Hakone and paid 4000 yen for an all day transportation pass. It included this boat ride and we did it. Just a pleasant 30 mins ride across a mountain Lake. You see the Otorii Gate for the Hakone shrine standing in water as well as another little
Will visit again as is a nice place. Raining make me disappointed for my hakone trip.. Hope to see you soon.
We took a boat ride on the lake. It was rather empty and very tranquil. The lake had many recreational opportunities for large and small.

If you have the Hakone Freepass with you, this cruise is a must to ride! There are 3 different pirate ships & depends on your luck on which ship you get to ride on~ It was a cloudy day with on & off rain in Hakone. We didn't get to see Fuji-san with the clouds in the way on the
Take a cruise around the lake or enjoy many of the water based or walking, cycling activities there. A must for a warm day but a no no for cold and wet days.

Lake Ashi is a scenic lake in Hakone area known for its views of Mount Fuji and its hot springs. We did a cruise of Lake Ashi while returning from Gotemba Peace Park. It was a short cruise of about 20 minutes, unfortunately it was raining and very cloudy not allowed us any view
We took a cruise around lake Ashi. It's a beautiful lake. If you are lucky you can see Mt Fuji from the cruise but we weren't that lucky that day !!!!
Excellent, a short cruise on a beautiful lake. We did it as part of our tour. A really beautiful place.

It's OK and worth going on the cablecar ropeway if not too cloudy but nothing really here. Restaurants are poor and some weren't even open when we got here early. Not very good. Starts to get SO busy too on ropeway around 11am so we were glad we did it early and out the way

We took the short boat ride from the Hakone Kojiri terminal to Hakone-en. There are restrooms on board. Lake Ashinoko is a crater lake. The ride is relaxing and the scenery of lake and mountains is awe-inspiring.

Nice scenic cruise in a large ferry with a comfortable interior lounge with recorded bilingual narration of what you're passing by. You'll see both fishing and pleasure boats on the lake, and a couple of bright orange Tori Gates (traditionally mark the entrance to Shinto
Beautiful lake with a great experience on one of these cool looking pirate ships. Great view of the famous landmark shrine. A good walk around the lake as well.

Enjoying the breeze of the mountain and lake wind while riding the pirate cruise is the best, you can enjoy the surrounding ocean of trees in any season, it's highly recommended to come here in autumn, when all the leaves are turning color and will become a hills of colours
Lots to do and lots to see at this beautiful lake. Cable cars, boat trips, lovely villages and fantastic restaurants. Be sure to visit Lake Ashi

...ฮาโกเนะ (Hakone) ตั้งอยู่บนสุดฝั่งตะวันตกของจังหวัดคานากาว่า (Kanagawa) การเดินทางจากโยโกฮาม่า ,โตเกียว สามารถทำได้สะดวก สามารถท่องเที่ยวแบบไป-กลับในหนึ่งวันได้และยังมี - ฮาโกเนะฟรีพาส (Hakone Freepas) ตั๋วราคาพิเศษ ที่ใช้ได้กับ โอดะคิว โรมานซ์คาร์ (Odakyu Romancecar)

Lake Ashi is close enough to Tokyo for a day trip but feels like a world away. You get out of the city and into the lush mountains of Japan! There is so much to see and do but if you stay overnight you can embrace the rich tranquility of the mountain area!

Came here as part of a tour that included Mt. Fuji and the 15 minute lake crossing made me want to go back to Hakone. The Lake seemed so peaceful and had all these little attractions and at least 2 cable cars to mountaintops. The crossing on a catamaran was really nice. I wish I

Located in kanagawa prefecture, lake ashi is a crater lake close to mount Hakone offering wonderful views of mount Fuji on a clear day. It is accessible by bus from the odawara and the hakone yumoto railway stations . It can also be reached using the hakone ropeway at togendai
Took tram, to ropeway, down to "pirate" Ship in order to cross the lake. We had a great time on the short cruise... Unfortunately didn't get to see Mt. Fuji due to fog.

We caught the ferry from one dude of the lake to the other. It's a pleasant boat ride with a commentary about features we passed in English which was informative . It would have been nice to see Mt Fuji but she was very shy that day! Nice!

Lake Ashi is such a beautiful sight. Just to see it from afar is gorgeous enough but make sure you take the pirate ship tour! It's so much fun because you get to have a closer look of the lake but also a better view of Mt. Fuji as well! You don't want to miss it! It's wonderful!
Lovely view of the forest and wonderful journey on the lake. We could not see Mt Fuji though as it was too cloudy. Nonetheless a lovely way to end the day after Mt Fuji.
Was part of a Mt Fuji tour. While Fuji was disappointing because of weather. The lake provided a nice departure from the bus and quick boat ride made the trip a little enjoyable.

This was one of my favorite stops in Japan. I went to try and see Mt. Fuji but the weather was not cooperating sadly. Still worth a trip for the beautiful views and I would 100% recommend this place to travelers!

We made a day travelling via the ropeway to the lake, and stopped at each of the 3 boat stops on Lake Ashi. The journey across is beautiful, on a clear day you would be able to see Mt Fuji from the lake but she hid from us until we were bac on the ropeway. There are three boat

We enjoyed lake Ashi by taking the cruise because it's included in the Hakone Free Pass itinerary. Mount Fuji is visible from the lake should the weather is clear. During my visit it was so foggy that the ship that's designated to travel to the Hakone Shrine is cancelled. But as

It's just another mountain lake. We went for the boat tour which is a ferry decorated into a pirate ship. There is not much to loose since it is included in a day ticket with traveling on the rope way and boat, unlimited!

A lovely experience that the whole family can enjoy. Take the train from Tokyo to Hakone from where you take the Tozan railway. You then take the cable car over the sulphurous mountain and then come down to the lake, where you can take the pirate ship across the lake. There is a
The lake is very beautiful. I arrived there in the morning. It's cold and no sunshine but still beautiful. Here is remind me , when i visit Koenig Lake in Germany. Fresh air / beautiful view / nature

Quiet and scenic lake just over the ridge from Mt. Fuji. Take the scenic gondola ride up to the peak for stellar views of the mountain and surrounding areas, then down to the lake for a hike or boat ride to the other side. We did the hike that traverses the far side of the lake

We had purchased the Hakone Free Pass which includes the boat ride so why not. The boats are very ornate - think fancy pirate ships. Unfortunately on the day we visited there was so much fog there was hardly everything for us to see. Nonetheless we enjoyed it. It must be
If you manage to be there during good weather there are plenty of nice spots to go from here like Skywalk Yunessun aquapark/onsen etc

I enjoyed the sail accross lake ashi on the pirate ship. We got the 4000 yen hakone pass at Odawara station, so this was included. Do really need longer than 5 hours to really enjoy the sights. We were much too rushed. The sail is nice and the ship look cool.

We took a bus down to the Lake from Hakone and were lucky to see some spectacular views of Mount Fuji. The lake itself is nice- you can wander, walk some of the trails and go to some lookouts. We took a boat over to the other side and continued from there. On a clear day the
There are nice trails around lake Ashi with lots of beautiful nature. We went for a refreshing swim in the lake which seems to be forbidden but I'd try it again anyway.

Like most sub-tropical places, clouds build as the soon as the sun rises, so it will be clearer views of Fuji-San before 10am. Lake Ashi is lovely even when Fuji is hiding. We plan to return in Fall or spring.
We took the pirate ship cruise. You'll see it as you walk around Hakone too. Beautiful! If you're lucky, you'll see Fuji-san too.

This is not a huge lake but it is fairly long and we traversed it with the help of a motorized pirate ship. Great fun for all the children including some of us adults. It takes about 25 minutes and provides a way of getting to the beginning of the cable car route up to the Geo

This is included with the Hakone Free Pass. We had a mid-morning cruise, and the weather was clear and sunny. So worth it to get to the pier- Hakonemachi-ko, on the other side of Lake Ashi. The shops in the small little covered area are worth going into. There is a small shop

We visited the place during their matsuri, and it was really nice. Beforr coming here, we traveled to Tokyo, and I was so happy to have come to this place. Its calming and beautiful, especially for those who aren't a fan of big cities. The view is just so amazing, the road and

On a clear day the lake is known for its Fuji views but we could only look out into grey as unfortunately we visited on an overcast day. This was made better though by the impressive ships, based on old sailing warships.

Lake Ashi is a very scenic lake which can be sailed on with the akone pirate ship. I enjoyed the views however, the day of the visit was a foggy and cloudy day so not much could be seen. It was quite disappointing, however I still had a good time.

The lake located on 700 meter above sea level is beautifully surrounded by the Mount Fuji hills. We took the pirate ship to enjoy the lake and it worth every penny. Due to the July clouds we were not able to see Mount Fuji, but the views are amazing.
We visited here recently and got in a quaint "pirate-like" ship and sailed across the lake. On a clear day you can see Mt Fuji from here.
We took a very nice boat ride down this lovely mountain lake, a nice change of pace from the hectic land tour. There are a couple of square-rig replicas that looked like more fun.
Took a boat trip from one end to the other., about 45 minutes Lake calm with good mountain scenery and few boats. Would have been possible on approach but alas cloudy.

A wonderful experience enriched by the stunning views and relaxing trip to get there from Odawara involving trains, cable cars and rope ways. We took the pirate-like boat to cruise the lake and truly enjoyed the place. Only possible with the fantastic Japanese infrastructure and

We went in May 2017 and sat near the windows and just watched the most beautiful, peaceful scenery for half an hour. The afternoon sun made the colours of the trees stand out as they covered the hills and grew over the waterline. Would come back here in a heartbeat.

Stunning beauty if you happen to visit on a clear day. The area is well preserved in a natural state with minimal development (ignoring the fake pirate ships). Easy to get around by public transportation (buses, trains, ropeways, boat). Spend some time hiking on the old Tokaido,

What a beautiful place on Lake Ashi The rooms are huge and overlooking the Lake. The earl morning walk in the grounds found rhododendron, flowering cherry blossom and tucked behind the clouds Mt Fuji. What a find.

Known as one of the best lake in the world with panoramic view of Mt. Fuji was simply breathtaking. One of my favourite place in Japan is Hakone. Beautiful scenery, lush greenery, friendly people. It is the best place to unwind and relax. From our hotel to Lake Ashinoko was just
After the cog train and cable car up the mountain we ended with a boat ride across the lake. Gorgeous spot!

text.wiki:
Hakone (箱根町, Hakone-machi) is a town in Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan. As of June 2012, the town had an estimated population of 13,492, and a population density of 145 persons per km². The total area is 92.82 km2 (35.84 sq mi). Hakone has been designated as a Japanese National Geopark by the Japanese Geoparks Network.
Hakone is to a great degree regarded as a traveler destination; Mt. Fuji can be seen when taking a day trip from Tokyo. In addition to hot springs, museums and other recreation activities, Hakone is known for its scenery during all four seasons.


== Geography ==
Hakone is located in the mountains in the far west of the prefecture, on the eastern side of Hakone Pass. Most of the town is within the borders of the volcanically active Fuji-Hakone-Izu National Park, centered on Lake Ashi.


=== Surrounding municipalities ===
Kanagawa Prefecture

Odawara
Yugawara
Minami-ashigaraShizuoka Prefecture

Gotemba
Susono
Mishima
Oyama
Kannami


== History ==
Hakone is the location of a noted Shinto shrine, the Hakone Gongen, which is mentioned in Heian period literature. During the Genpei War, Minamoto no Yoritomo prayed at this shrine for victory over his enemies, after his defeat at the Battle of Ishibashiyama, which was fought in neighboring Manazuru. As with the rest of Sagami Province, the area came under the control of the later Hōjō clan of Odawara during the Sengoku period. After the start of the Edo period, Hakone-juku was a post station on the Tōkaidō highway connecting Edo with Kyoto. It was also the site of a major barrier and official checkpoint on the route known as the Hakone Checkpoint (箱根関所, Hakone sekisho), which formed the border of the Kantō region. Under the Tokugawa shogunate, all travellers entering and leaving Edo along the Tōkaidō were stopped here by officials. Their travel permits and baggage were examined to enforce Tokugawa laws that restricted the travel of women and weapons.
After the start of the Meiji Restoration, Hakone became a part of the short-lived Ashigara Prefecture before becoming part of Ashigarashimo District in Kanagawa prefecture in August 1876. Hakone attained town status in 1889. The imperial household established the summer Hakone Imperial Villa close to the lake.
After merger with five neighboring towns and villages in September 1956, it reached its present boundaries.


== Economy ==

The economy of Hakone is strongly dominated by the tourist industry. Hakone is noted for its onsen hot spring resorts, which attract both Japanese and international visitors, due to its proximity to the greater Tokyo metropolis and to Mount Fuji. Sights include the volcanically active Ōwakudani geysers and Hakone Shrine on the shore of the lake, as well as the Hakone Botanical Garden of Wetlands. In April the cherry blossoms (sakura) and in autumn the Miscanthus sinensis (susuki) are noted sights.
Hakone has a number of art museums, including the Hakone Open-Air Museum and Pola Museum of Art.
Major events include the annual JLPGA CAT Ladies Golf tournament and the Hakone Ekiden, a long distance collegiate foot race, held at the New Year, which runs from Tokyo to Hakone and back over two days, partly in commemoration of the couriers who ran the Tōkaidō road.
One famous hotel in Hakone is the historic Fujiya Hotel in Miyanoshita, which was patronized by noted literary figures, politicians and foreign dignitaries in the Meiji and Taishō and early Shōwa periods.
A noted local handicraft is a kind of marquetry called Yosegi.Hakone is also well-known among anime fans for being the main location in the manga and anime series Neon Genesis Evangelion, in which it has been renamed Tokyo-3, and there are numerous attractions related to the franchise offered in the town. In 2017, Hakone was included as one of 88 anime pilgrimage sites for 2018 by the Anime Tourism Association. In 2020, new decorations have been introduced to the city in the anticipation of the release of the final film of the Rebuild of Evangelion tetralogy.


== Transportation ==


=== Railway ===
Hakone Tozan Railway
Hakone Tozan Cable Car
Hakone Ropeway
Izuhakone RailwayOdawara and Mishima, the terminus of the Odakyū Odawara Line, 70 minutes from Shinjuku, Tokyo. From Odawara, the Hakone Tozan Line continues into various resort towns in Hakone. Odakyu also runs the Romancecar limited express between Shinjuku and Hakone-Yumoto. From Gōra, the terminus of Hakone Tozan Line, the Hakone Tozan Cable Car funicular goes to Sōunzan. Ōwakudani can be reached by Hakone Ropeway from Sounzan and the lake, while the lake is crisscrossed by cartoonishly decorated "pirate" ships for tourists. There is also Hakone Komagatake Ropeway, which goes to the top of Mount Komagatake.
A popular "Hakone Free Pass", allowing unlimited use of most forms of transport for several days, is available. Hakone Free Pass can be bought at Shinjuku Station, Odawara Station, any other chief station along Odakyū Odawara Line, Hakone-Yumoto Station, Gōra Station, any other chief station along Hakone Tozan Line, Sōunzan Station, Tōgendai Station, Sengoku-Annaijo Bus Stop, Moto-Hakone Port, Hakone-Machi Port, and JR Gotemba Station Bus Information.


=== Highways ===
Hakone Shindō
Japan National Route 1
Japan National Route 138


== Education ==
Private schools:

Kanrei Shirayuri Gakuen Junior/Senior High School


== Sister cities ==
 - Tōyako, Hokkaidō, since July 4, 1964
 - Jasper, Alberta, Canada from July 4, 1972
 - Taupo, New Zealand, from October 7, 1987
 - St. Moritz, Switzerland, from November 2, 2014 (Friendship City)

text.wiki:
Hakone (箱根町, Hakone-machi) is a town in Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan. As of June 2012, the town had an estimated population of 13,492, and a population density of 145 persons per km². The total area is 92.82 km2 (35.84 sq mi). Hakone has been designated as a Japanese National Geopark by the Japanese Geoparks Network.
Hakone is to a great degree regarded as a traveler destination; Mt. Fuji can be seen when taking a day trip from Tokyo. In addition to hot springs, museums and other recreation activities, Hakone is known for its scenery during all four seasons.


== Geography ==
Hakone is located in the mountains in the far west of the prefecture, on the eastern side of Hakone Pass. Most of the town is within the borders of the volcanically active Fuji-Hakone-Izu National Park, centered on Lake Ashi.


=== Surrounding municipalities ===
Kanagawa Prefecture

Odawara
Yugawara
Minami-ashigaraShizuoka Prefecture

Gotemba
Susono
Mishima
Oyama
Kannami


== History ==
Hakone is the location of a noted Shinto shrine, the Hakone Gongen, which is mentioned in Heian period literature. During the Genpei War, Minamoto no Yoritomo prayed at this shrine for victory over his enemies, after his defeat at the Battle of Ishibashiyama, which was fought in neighboring Manazuru. As with the rest of Sagami Province, the area came under the control of the later Hōjō clan of Odawara during the Sengoku period. After the start of the Edo period, Hakone-juku was a post station on the Tōkaidō highway connecting Edo with Kyoto. It was also the site of a major barrier and official checkpoint on the route known as the Hakone Checkpoint (箱根関所, Hakone sekisho), which formed the border of the Kantō region. Under the Tokugawa shogunate, all travellers entering and leaving Edo along the Tōkaidō were stopped here by officials. Their travel permits and baggage were examined to enforce Tokugawa laws that restricted the travel of women and weapons.
After the start of the Meiji Restoration, Hakone became a part of the short-lived Ashigara Prefecture before becoming part of Ashigarashimo District in Kanagawa prefecture in August 1876. Hakone attained town status in 1889. The imperial household established the summer Hakone Imperial Villa close to the lake.
After merger with five neighboring towns and villages in September 1956, it reached its present boundaries.


== Economy ==

The economy of Hakone is strongly dominated by the tourist industry. Hakone is noted for its onsen hot spring resorts, which attract both Japanese and international visitors, due to its proximity to the greater Tokyo metropolis and to Mount Fuji. Sights include the volcanically active Ōwakudani geysers and Hakone Shrine on the shore of the lake, as well as the Hakone Botanical Garden of Wetlands. In April the cherry blossoms (sakura) and in autumn the Miscanthus sinensis (susuki) are noted sights.
Hakone has a number of art museums, including the Hakone Open-Air Museum and Pola Museum of Art.
Major events include the annual JLPGA CAT Ladies Golf tournament and the Hakone Ekiden, a long distance collegiate foot race, held at the New Year, which runs from Tokyo to Hakone and back over two days, partly in commemoration of the couriers who ran the Tōkaidō road.
One famous hotel in Hakone is the historic Fujiya Hotel in Miyanoshita, which was patronized by noted literary figures, politicians and foreign dignitaries in the Meiji and Taishō and early Shōwa periods.
A noted local handicraft is a kind of marquetry called Yosegi.Hakone is also well-known among anime fans for being the main location in the manga and anime series Neon Genesis Evangelion, in which it has been renamed Tokyo-3, and there are numerous attractions related to the franchise offered in the town. In 2017, Hakone was included as one of 88 anime pilgrimage sites for 2018 by the Anime Tourism Association. In 2020, new decorations have been introduced to the city in the anticipation of the release of the final film of the Rebuild of Evangelion tetralogy.


== Transportation ==


=== Railway ===
Hakone Tozan Railway
Hakone Tozan Cable Car
Hakone Ropeway
Izuhakone RailwayOdawara and Mishima, the terminus of the Odakyū Odawara Line, 70 minutes from Shinjuku, Tokyo. From Odawara, the Hakone Tozan Line continues into various resort towns in Hakone. Odakyu also runs the Romancecar limited express between Shinjuku and Hakone-Yumoto. From Gōra, the terminus of Hakone Tozan Line, the Hakone Tozan Cable Car funicular goes to Sōunzan. Ōwakudani can be reached by Hakone Ropeway from Sounzan and the lake, while the lake is crisscrossed by cartoonishly decorated "pirate" ships for tourists. There is also Hakone Komagatake Ropeway, which goes to the top of Mount Komagatake.
A popular "Hakone Free Pass", allowing unlimited use of most forms of transport for several days, is available. Hakone Free Pass can be bought at Shinjuku Station, Odawara Station, any other chief station along Odakyū Odawara Line, Hakone-Yumoto Station, Gōra Station, any other chief station along Hakone Tozan Line, Sōunzan Station, Tōgendai Station, Sengoku-Annaijo Bus Stop, Moto-Hakone Port, Hakone-Machi Port, and JR Gotemba Station Bus Information.


=== Highways ===
Hakone Shindō
Japan National Route 1
Japan National Route 138


== Education ==
Private schools:

Kanrei Shirayuri Gakuen Junior/Senior High School


== Sister cities ==
 - Tōyako, Hokkaidō, since July 4, 1964
 - Jasper, Alberta, Canada from July 4, 1972
 - Taupo, New Zealand, from October 7, 1987
 - St. Moritz, Switzerland, from November 2, 2014 (Friendship City)


== Gallery ==

Gora Park is conveniently located 5 mins on foot from Koen-kami station. Or you can also opt to walk up 10mins on a steep slope from Gora station. Entrance to the park is free with your Hakone Freepass. Unfortunately, when we went there in mid-sept, there is nothing much too see
