Gora Park is quite pleasant and worth visiting. You can access it on your Hakone Paa. There is a picnic area with drinks vending machines. Allow about 30 minutes to walk around it. The layout is good. There is also a craft centre in the park.
When we visited there was snow on the ground and was very cold. This did not stop us enjoying the visit. For a hidden surprise find the traditional tea houses and enjoy tea!

We visited this park on a rainy day. It was very pretty with some cherry blossom blooming. We found the tea house and enjoyed traditional green tea and snack. We were a little disappointed as we thought the tea would have been made in front of us. Other than that it was very

The so called French park in this area has some French style buildings and landscape. However, it is a small park on the slope of Mt. Hakone. The park has a couple of greenhouses for tropical plants and flowers but it is mainly for tea time visits only.

Before taking the cable car, I decided to spent some time around this little place. Found this pretty garden and surprisingly it is free with Hakone pass. Spent half an hour there and had a quiet moment away from other tourists!
I am here now and there are tons of people especially for the craft house. The admission is 550 and children free under 12

Was very misty and wet when we went here, garden though was very nice indeed, great autumn colours and well laid out, shop and snacks on site too, pity the weather was so bad, in the sunshine it would have been so much better.
Perhaps Japanese people don't have enough access to green space, to pay to enter a park with not much of a special theme is kind of weird.
Its quite a peaceful place to spend some time in the beautiful city of Hakone. The flower gardens are beautiful and its a nice walk around the park.

I went this place with my brother and sister who lives in Japan.First we went to Hakone Volcano.After very tired journey we went to this place...I don't know what happened to tired of me..It went lost :D :D.Specially I went there to see Autumn leaves and I realize this is the

Very nice and quiet park, very small as well. Nothing much special, I will say only come here when you have extra time. From my opinion, it is actually better to say in the hotel to enjoy the hotspring lol. One thing to mention is there is a craft house inside the park, if you

Entrance is free with the Hakone Freepass but we all regretted visiting. The garden is set on a hillside and we started at the lower side and had to hike going up. It was winter so only a few patches of winter blooms can be seen. There is a small greenhouse but since we were

Stayed near this garden and used the hakone free pass to enter. The garden is pretty small and perhaps it was winter and the leaves have largely fallen, but I personally felt that the garden was not very impressive not well maintained. Do not recommend this unless you have time
beautiful garden with lots of different types of flowers. I especially enjoyed all the different types of roses.
If you are hard pressed for time, you can give this a miss as it is a rather small park that you can walk from one end to the other in less than half an hour.
This park is very nice, with tropical garden and a glass and ceramic factory and shop. In addition to this the entrance is free with the Hakone free pass.

The park is built on a slope. You can enter on the upper entrance (from the 2nd stop of the Cable car) and walk down. There are many steps to handle. It is definitely unsuited for the wheelchair bound. Elders who do not walk well have problems too, as there are practically no
The park is beautiful, especially in the fall with the autumn colors. THe crafthouses allow visitors to make beads, glasswork, or pottery. Very fun.

The park featuring western style gardens with fountain and an old tree. There is also a rose garden, green houses and occasional plants exhibitions. Was here because Hakone Free Pass provide free access. It is possible to see the 大文字山 from the garden.

Western style park with a large fountain in the middle. Set on the hillside so there a quite a few steps to get around. Cafes in the middle of the park provide a welcome respite after wandering around the place. The Craft House in the grounds of the park was very interesting

If you purchase a Hakone Free Pass, the garden is free. It's hilly--be prepared to walk! It's also near the amazing tonkatsu restaurant, so you can gain back the weight you lost walking. There are a couple greenhouses with tropical flowers. It takes maybe an hour to

I enjoyed my walk in this garden. Impressive fountain. Take your time. Many different focal,points. Mountain in its background. Also creative shops in there. Also a conservatory of unusual collection of begonias, and others. Worth a visit.

Not exactly the main tourist spots in Hakone but worth the visit. Delighted by the layout; able to admire the botany amidst the backdrop of the mountain while sitting on a bench enjoying the cool weather. Check out the craft center too. Not so keen on the cafe though; quite

The gardens were ok when we were there but all of the fountains were drained for maintenance so it sort of detracted from the ambience. Strolling through the gardens you can see different areas with different flowers. Best time to go is early spring when everything seems to be
It took us some time to find the place and we had great difficulty parking. In our view not really worth the effort, but OK.

In winter the park is covered in a blanket of snow so I can only imagine how lovely it would be when the flowers are blooming in spring or summer. There is a nice view of the mountains in the background and the park in the foreground near the top of the multi tiered park. Lots

Gora Park is a stone throw away from Gora Station where most visitors make transit from train to tram or vice visa to Togendai. It is worth a visit as the garden is very well maintain. There are a little art and craft house, a couple of good café/restaurants for short breaks. Of

Such a pretty park. Inside is the Crafthouse which is worth a visit. You can make crafts or buy them. There are lots of beautiful plants and a fountain. Features a nice coffee shop. The tracks are not all smooth and it is on a steep hill making it unsuitable for some.

Nice scenery but a small park. I like the flowers and the botanic garden there. Although small but worth to visit. You need to go up the slope at Gora station around 5 min walk. I recommend to go as there are some shops and restaurants that you can go for your lunch there.

It turns out that Japan has another great treasure in addition to the cherry blossoms in the spring, the arrival of hydrangeas blooming in June. We never that that there were so many different varieties of hydrangeas. They are outstanding. This park has greenhouses with various

It's well designed park with lots of different species of plants. But, it's a bit pricey with ¥500 entrance fee. If you have time, it's worth to visit the tea house inside the park for morning / afternoon tea. Easy access with the Tozan "S line" Sightseeing bus stop right in
We visited this park in the rain during April (cherry blossom time). Even with the rain we found it very interesting and would love to return in late May or June when more of the garden is in bloom

We needed to rest a bit after a busy day walking. This is definetely the place. Not a japanese garden, but full of flowers from all over the world. Ice cream parlour and tea room and snack bar available
The perfect place to spend a sunny day in a gorgeous garden and have a sweet Ice cream in the nature. Highly reccomended with children
Azaleas are everywhere; they're very colorful! The garden sets nicely. There's a pool in the middle of the garden; perhaps this is the highlight of this garden.
That's the best part in Hakone ! You could stay away from tourists during one hour in the huge garden.

Visited this beautiful garden as a part of our day trip to Hakone-machi using the 2-days Hakone Free-pass. The garden is around 10 mins uphill walk from the Gora station. The garden is located at the base of a mountain and is divided into various sections depending upon the
Such beautiful grounds and beautiful pieces. The foliage is gorgeous and there are so many places to wander.
Its free admission if we buy Hakone 3 daypass. beautiful place for taking beautiful picture. also if we just want to enjoy the flowers and the garden, its worth it.

I went with friends towards the tail end of the cherry blossom season and there were some trees blooming. In addition there are many varieties of plants and flora to look at and appreciate. Not being a flower lover, even I was able to enjoy the array and beauty the park had to

Free entry with the Hakone pass and you get a map showing you all the flowers in the park with the blossom times. Be sure to try the hydrangea-flavoured ice-cream (not sure if it's a season's special or not). Japanese are so imaginative with their ice-cream flavours! I
It was filled with cherry blossoms every where. Enjoy the landscaping which is very French. The highlight here is the fountain which turns into ice during winter

We went there end of March. No flowers were blooming yet. The park has many roses and hydrangeas and cherry trees that bloom later in the season, Probably more interesting then. The tropical garden in the green house is interesting though at any time. Entrance is free if you

We visited this large park late March, too early for blossoms. We paid about US$5 entrance fee. The uphill walk from Gora station took us about 10 minute walk. It was a beautiful cool sunny day with a great view. There was a unique bush with yellow/white flowers but bare of

It's free entry to this park if you get the Hakone free pass. Within walking distance from Gora Station, but it's an uphill walk, rather steep. Suggest to approach by taking one stop on the cable car to avoid the uphill walk. When we were there, the main exhibit in the event

We went to the crafthouse and made two mugs, the instructors there were very helpful, but it could be possible that you will have to use simple English in order to communicate with them. (I could understand Japanese and spoke very simple Japanese so I couldn't say for sure).
Beautiful as well as relaxing, you can stroll through the gardens at your leisure. My five grand children found the park interesting and enjoyed the time spent at the park.
We were keen to maximize our onsen stay so this was the only place we visited within walking distance of our onsen. It was a nice walk at sunset

It was touted as a French inspired garden, beautiful in all seasons. But when we got there, the shrubbery was scagly, the fountain was undergoing repair and some footpaths were under maintenance. Maybe it is a repair phase and hopefully the park will look much better real soon.

Recommended to see it in all its flaming glory during autumn. Other than a beautifully-manicured garden, artistically structured landscaping with fountains and the mountains as a backdrop, there are cake and coffee as well as souvenir, art and craft outlets for an all-rounded
It can be a pleasant place to walk around if you happen to be in the area, but there is nothing exceptional about it.

Easily accessible via public transportation -part of your Hakone Freepass- entrance fee is waived (FREE). Lovely landscapes, including multiple tiered stone pathways, tea houses, greenhouses, fountains, etc. end your visit at the Crafthouse, where you can purchase crafts such

It's quite a steep walk from the station without knowing it :) nevertheless we make our way there! once you finally reach the fountain area it was worth the steep walk :) We have coffee & cake in the café overseeing the fountain. How nice if this café could be smoke free as

You may either walk to this park from Gora station, or take the cable car and get down at Koen Shimo station ( one station away from Gora station ). The park was much bigger than expected.. Just when you thought you have cover all the spots, there is another path leading to new
Overpriced (unless you have the Hakone "Free" Pass), unfriendly and unhelpful staff. Avoid if possible (go to the Hakone Open Air Museum instead to keep your young kids entertained).

Easily accessibly by cable car. Exit station, veer left and you'll see the ticket booth in approximately 50 meters. It costs ¥500 per adult. It's a rather compact park with cafes, a glass house selling seedlings, a Craft House which conducts pottery and glass blasting (etching)

Five minutes walk from the cablecar, it is on many levels and they are all attractively laid out - lots of benches, too. There's a set of glasshouses halfway up on the right with some pretty interesting flora, and at the bottom there is a craft shop and, much more interesting, a

Visited before the full autumn change in colours and it was still beautiful. We arrived in Hakone after a busy week in Tokyo so the picturesque serenity of Goen Park was much needed! The park itself isn't that big as parks go, but I got the feel that it has been
For the admission price, there are better things to see in Hakone. The park is nice, not bad, but nothing extraordinary by Japanese standards.

Maybe I went in the wrong season between flowering and fall colours, but this park didn't blossom to the max on me. It is pretty, small and quick to pass through. Some really nice scenery, but it was clouded today,and maybe that made it a little bit dampen for me. Still,
This park is currently under a needed construction. Anyway the park is very nice a little aside from the main path in Hakone both worth a short visit
Visited this Park in Hakone, we can see the Owakudani valley and its natural sulphure gas from this park. Nice little park that is not too crowded and the air is very fresh and cool for relaxing.

This garden is pretty big, and they have Japanese tea house, cafe (Western style) and tropical plants house. You can see cherry blossoms in spring and can see roses, hydrangeas, lavenders in summer. Also craft house allows you to try to create some Japanese traditional stuff.
The park was areanged in europe style, which is different from general japanese park. You can get in without admission if you have free pass. (fuji hakone free pass)
This is a beautiful park, even on a drizzly day during the "tsuyu" or rainy season. The huge fountain is beautiful with a backdrop of mountains.

This is Japan's oldest formal French garden and in it's day must have been quite unusual. It is most easily reached from the first stop on the funicular from Gora to Souzan. Entry is included in the Hakone Free Pass. The garden is laid out up a steep hillside with the top
Lovely little stroll. Perfectly pretty garden. But if you don't have time, don't worry, though. It was nice but not really "great."

Me and my wife visited this place. Small but very beautiful. The garden was full of different kind of roses. The view of mountain from there was very nice. Inside the garden was tea house for tea ceremony.

hydrangea season and the end of azaleas made this garden pop with color. Also the craft house provides for an extra fee opportunities for ceramics, dried flower arranging and glass blowing for the whole family.

From Gora station by walk only 5 minutes. It is very relaxing and pretty park with fountain, garden of roses, greenhouses, restaurant and Hakuun-do Chai tea room. There is also Crafthouse where you can try glass etching, glass blowing, pottery etc. It takes from 30 minutes to 1

We visited Gora Park with our one year old granddaughter who loves outdoors. Firstly the path from the station is very steep and pushing a stroller up there is a challenge. Once inside the park there are hundreds of steps and unevenly paved pathways. It's not well set up for
A nice park in old style just to stroll in. Hakone Art Museum is very close, much more to see but you cannot really compare. See them both!

Its a small park with a nice cafe/restaurant and a craft shop. Depending on the season there should be different kinds of flowers blooming, I went in the wrong timing, but still there was a lot of green scenery and it felt peaceful and nice there. Just 2 minutes walk from the

The weather was a bit misty and foggy when we went, but that just made our walk in nature all that much lovelier. Admittance is free for tourists who have the Hakone Free Pass. A small gem in Hakone, I suggest you go to the Craft House inside as well.
On a rather small surface a very nice variety of gardens is presented. Do not miss this little pearl.

You get free entrance if you have a Hakone travel pass. It is worth going to see, weather could have been better, would have put a better perspective on the place, too early for the cherry blossom. Spring was just about arriving when I visited. Again use the Hakone travel pass,
A picture perfect park with nice fountain and step set up was admirable. Had some nice Japanese food in the restaurant at the park
We had the extraordinary fortune of being in Gora at peak leaf time. Just gorgeous. Peaceful. Gora is like nothing else you may have seen any other place in the world.

Gora Park was the first attraction we visited upon setting foot in Hakone. It is only a few minutes walk from Gora station. Entry is free if you have the Hakone Free Pass. As we were carrying our overnight bags, we were thankful for lockers located near the entrance. The garden

Celebrating its 100 year anniversary, Gora Park (強羅公園) was the most beautiful garden we visited in Hakone during mid May. It only took us less than 10 minutes walking from the Gora Station to get there. Opened in 1914, Gora Park was the first French style garden in Japan mainly
We stumbled on the park when we walked around. It is well set out and there is plenty to see. Very nice views of the mountains. Very nice roses all around.

Was delighted to visit Hakone during the tsuyu season (rainy season) as it wasn't very rainy, and it is the season which hydrangeas bloom. There was a whole greenhouse for the hydrangeas, with a variety of colours, including white, pink, blue, purple, green, and many shades in
It was under a lot of maintenance and nothing was in bloom (obviously) but the park looked bad with that combo of repairs underway and dead/dormant plants

This a nice small park at the first stop of the cable car. We went in the fall and saw beautiful changing colored leaves. There are a few small green houses with a nice variety of flowers. As you walk up the hill there is fountain by a small restaurant. I really enjoyed the
Gora Park is a nice, but small scenic endeavor. They've got tea houses, a craft shop, and a mini insect zoo. Nothing too special.

公园的范围不是很大可以说一下子就可以走完了。这里有什么特别呢？如果喜欢花花草草的朋友这地方必定是他们最希望的好去处. The range is not large park can be said at once can finish it. What is special about this place? If you like plants and flowers friends this place is definitely a good place they most want.

I visited the park on a quiet sunny morning in the beginning of April. I found the experience quite enjoyable and was surprised to find that the complex was much bigger than I orginally thought. It was easily accessible by taking the train to Gora Station and then walking for

We came across the park by chance, as we were staying nearby. In May the azaleas were in full bloom, and set against the backdrop of the mountains the park looked amazing. The glass houses were also full of of beautiful flowers such as hydrangeas, orchids, and bougainvilleas.

Don't think it is worth going. We did not have to pay for entrance because it was included in the Hakone Free Pass we bought. There wasn't much thing to see except an autumn flower/plant exhibition. Most of the plants were having their end of flowering period. Since autumn

The park is a short bus ride from the Gora station. I reckon it will take about 15 minutes ito walk to the park if you choose to do so. Even though it was raining on the day I visited, i don't think time is well spent at the park. I have been to many parks with better layout and

must go to the craft house if you have at least 2day at hakone. go there at the first day and try the blow glass . it need a night to cool off so tomorrow morning you can pick it up. is a great experience. they have poutary too but need a month to harden .
google: Nice park close to Gora station, entry is free if you have the Hakone pass. Nice fountain at the centre and scenic views from the top. There is also a nice Rose garden & Cedar tree in the Center. It would take maybe 20 mins to cover the whole place
Absolutely stunning during spring. Big space to walk and the colors vivid. Must visit in Hakone
calm park with a beautiful fountain and wonderful colors... visited it in a rainy day but it just was more charming... I totally liked it

text.quote: Small waterfall with string-like lines of water, leafy surrounds & several hiking trails nearby.
trip: The place is not as spectacular as the images might suggest. There is a lot of rock-slide going on, meaning that on the next occasion the entire thing might slide off the the mountain too, changing the landscape. Its not a majestic waterfal or anything. Left and right of it the
Went for a stroll which ended up as a 2 hours hike with a 2 Yr old on my back. Really enjoyed the nature The falls are close to the road so possible to visit the falls without breaking a sweat
A short hike to a beautiful setting. The falls aren’t huge but they’re worth the trip! Get off the tour bus route and venture here for some relaxation.
Probably the wrong season, waterfall was a trickle, the positive thing, it was empty of people. A 10mim.walk from the bus stop gets you there. Have to walk up a short but steep paved road

It was very near where we stayed (Kowakien Miyamafurin); a pleasant 10-15 min stroll. There were hardly any tourists there so we had the whole place to ourselves. They had some benches and tables if you wish to sit or pack along a bento or just relax.
It's only a 5 minute hike from the road to enjoy this tranquil spot surrounded by nature. The path is rather steep though.
Good short hike, that you can extend to go further to the mountains if the weather is good. Highly recommended!

We visited this waterfall during a long weekend in July. Hakone was full of people, but we did not see many people at the waterfall. It was quiet, and very calming. We loved it! The hike is not too difficult, but it's not a place where you wanna go with your flipflops.

Not jaw dropping but quite lovely. Very popular with professional photographers doing fashion shoots. Fooled me into thinking that the couple were real bride and groom. Not crowded and well worth the walk.

Very pretty, just like the pictures. Also very peacefule...no tourists except us! We thought that this might be difficult to find. Very easy with information from the information desk at the train station in Gora. Very flat and easy walk (as opposed to most hikes in the area).

We happened to stay near these falls and took a walk there as recommended by our hotel. The path was a bit hard to find but once we found it, the walking was easy. The falls were lovely and worth the walk (about 30 minutes in our case). It was a pleasant activity at the end of a

What a waste of time! Especially if you try to approach it from the high access point (one bus stop up the hill from the station) - but at least you go downhill. Completely unmarked route, requiring many tries up the garden path and asking locals.. And then... you get to a
since i went in summer, there's nothing special. It's. famous for autumn and winter. transportation is convenient.

I found these falls on Trip Advisor and I'm so glad I got off at the Station for the short walk. When you exit the station, there is one little sign at the road. Continue on the road ahead that slopes upward only after you've memorized the name of the falls in Japanese. That
google: This is a lovely place to sit and have a lunch with your family. The waterfall is amazing and because of the rain today the stream was really moving and sounded beautiful. Even though it was sprinkling rain we were still able to stay fairly …
Quiet trekking trail to the waterfall right next to the bus stop, can get confused on the way back.. falls are small but calm
This was a 3 min walk from the trail head and totally awesome. 10/10 would recommend. Expect to spend no more than 10 mins at this trail junction
Beautiful waterfalls. It was a fairly short hike down some stairs from the road.

Great little area. Beautiful waterfall, surrounded by plush greenery and fairly remote so if you want to escape the crowds this is a fantastic spot to do so. It's also the start of a short hike if you're that way inclined

It's extra pretty when there are no people around because of the Corona lockdown.  But you can certainly smell the sulfur in the air around here.  And the water tasted a little sulfury too.  (don't judge, I was dying.  I'd just come from a multi-hour hike! lol)

Serene and quiet area with a small yet beautiful waterfall. The area provides for amazing photo opportunities if you're willing to drop down to the river bed. 

Would definitely recommend giving this area a go, as it is not far from the bus stop anyways.
Easy walk there and back. Not very big but still nice.

Streaming down a 20-metre-wide (66-feet-wide) stretch of moss-covered rock, the majestic Chisuji Falls form the basis of many hikes through the forest of Hakone’s Kowakudani region. Summer evenings bring a flock of genji fireflies to the …
Lovely cool waterfall spot that is unspoilt
This remarkable natural spectacle feels like it is straight out of a Miyazaki animation. You keep expecting to turn and see a small woodland spirit or two peeking through the woodland at you.

Parking is a little tough. It pretty much comes tonally dead end and a path off the the right is where you need to go down. When you get to the bottom trail taken right and you start to see the falls. It is small but still looks amazing. …
No parking lots. Roads are one way. Very narrow
Cute little waterfall that meets at the intersection of several trails.
A lot of water, roots of trees, steep ways and beauty of nature
Nice and quiet. Water is amazingly clean and warmer than I thought.
They are to short  to be honest, fortunately there is no fee to get into it, but you will have to walk around 15 minutes to get there.
The nice place to take pictures and enjoy to be in nature.  You can have fun river by the place too.
Quite a small waterfall. Good for a detour when headed to Goes station.
I loved the place
A hot water waterfall. Nice pleasant place. We visited in January, but I presume it is much more beautiful when everything is green. There are also hiking trails around.
Nice, but you dont really miss something if you don't see it.
Lovley little waterfall in hakone... Loved it

Much smaller than the photos led me to expect! I wouldn’t go out of your way to visit here, though I expect it’s nice in autumn or when blossoms are out. Good to pass by if you are having a walk around the area.
Really nice place, the walk from there to Mt. Sengen was really really enjoyable, maybe not the best for people who don't want to get their shoes dirty.
Great place for a walk in Hakone woods, from here there's a 30 min walk to the top of Mt. Sengen, I strongly advice to go there.

Hidden gem tucked away. Its a small 5 minute trek from the road. Great for anyone adventurous and seems to be only be known by locals. In our trek, we only saw 3 other Japanese people. It was a wonderful area to appreciate the nature and for photos

Awesome piece of nature hiding in plain sight.

If you are thinking of cool a dip in the water, the stream opposite to the falls is the place. The falls per se is just for viewing. You can get into the pool of the falls but the floor of the pool is very marshy and the stream of the falling water is not enough.
A beautiful hidden gem in the Hakone area. Short easy walk, and a must visit.
Can be muddy there, be prepared
Called the waterfall of a thousand threads, it is a small but yet peaceful waterfall for those seeking inner peace and zen.
It s a kind of unpopular place, it s not amazing but perfect to chill
Really nice, beautiful waterfalls.
A lot of small waterfalls. Beautiful to see. Way to get there is very wet. Small rivers are crossing the hiking trail. Good shoes for the hiking trail itself to the woods is recommended.
Nice an quiet Place, more than worth to visit!

What a super waterfalls nestled in the mountains. Not very high maybe 3.5 metters but long. Possibly 10 meters.  If you look closely you will find the only fresh water crab in Japan. They are in the moss and rock holes on the waterfalls …
Beutiful but not easy to access.
Small but nice feeling area. Has 30-40 min walking trials.
Also worth a look
Disappointed, the falls are pretty small and not very impressive
Amazing natural beauty!!!
Just small falls
Amazing view
Awesome place
Beautiful!
nice small falls..

アクセスが良くないせいか、ほとんど観光客もおらず静謐な空気にひたれます。

text.quote: Opened in 1988, this art museum features Nihonga-style paintings, city views, a cafe & gardens.
trip: I visited the museum located in Hakone Lake Ashi quite late in the evening with a tourist bus. It was a rainy day so I was not able to enjoy the picturesque view of lake Ashi and Mt. Fuji from the observation gallery. It was a small museum but it could be an itinerary which not

We spent some time here having ascended the elevators to enter a collection of great Japanese artwork from painting to carving. The subtlety of the brushwork just stopped us with its detail and colour. Room after room celebrated a series of great artists. Moving and powerful.

To be honest, we went to this museum because it was the ONLY place with a cafe open for a late breakfast in the ENTIRE town. The little sandwich was perfectly fine, but what made it most enjoyable was the lovely view of the lake (Mt Fuji was hidden by clouds). The art

I was appalled at the treatment I was given at a visit with my wife to the Museum. My wife wanted to visit the museum and I was with her. I have Parkinson’s Disease and when we visited the museum my medication was low so I was struggling to walk so could not go round the

Fortunately we arrived on a fine day, and the view of the lake and Mt Fuji from the panoramic windows of the lounge was spectacular. A real work of art. The same cannot be said for the gallery's collection of paintings - most glossy kitsch. The only collection with a touch of

As we walked into the museum, a spectacular view of Mt Fuji literally took our breath away and we had to sit down. Our view was of Lake Ashi with Mt Fuji right above the lake! Within 30 minutes, the clouds rolled in! The art on display were mostly Japanese water colors and very

We came here on a very windy and cold day in Hakone. Would definitely recommend coming here for a cup of coffee taking in the incredible views of Mount Fuji if the weather is cold! Nice little cafe, can’t say we really looked at the art at all though!

This museum, beautifully set at the south end of Lake Ashi, with a view of Mt. Fuji on clear days (not always possible), has a stunning collection of Japanese paintings by 20th Century artists. Beautiful artwork on display - very restful - subjects focus largely on nature. One

Narukawa Museum is only one museum to display Japanese collections thanks to Mr. Narukawa. NHK broadcast TV camera is set inside this building, scenery from a big window is so beautiful panorama Lake Asai and Mt. Fuji. Japanese painting are depicted on WASHI(Japanese genuine

This art museum is located in Hakone. Honestly, I enjoyed the view of Lake Ashi from the observation gallery at the museum more than the paintings and art work. Yes, this small museum has a large collection of Japanese style paintings. This museum was included on our Gate1
A good place to relax and see personal collection of local Japanese artist. During a clear day, we can see the whole Lake Ashi and Hakone.

The Narukawa Art Museum was founded in 1988, and houses modern Japanese paintings. The art is interesting but I enjoyed the garden more. It had flowers, sculptures, and quite places to sit. There was also a picture window where you could sit and enjoy Mt. Fuji. I was very

This art museum has many styles of art on show o two floors. even if you are not an arty person some of these paintings are really beautiful particularly the ones of blossoms. There is a picture window where you can sit and on a clear day see Mt Fuji in the distance. Also a
great for a rainy day the museum has the most beautiful pieces of glass klidescopes i have ever seen and magnificent sculptures carved of 1 piece of wood or bone

Two floors of well displayed pieces. Large rooms with nice presentation and lighting. Views of Lake Ashi and Mt. Fuji. Limited English, but OK, signage. Small in total but lovely. Lockers. Worth your time to walk through. It this review is helpful then please indicate so
Some of the great Japanese artists can be viewed here as well as breathtaking views of Mount Fuji over coffee. What’s not to like?

This a "bonus" visit on our tour to Fuji-yama, as our intended boat ride was too windy to take. So the guide quickly arranged this stop and we were very happy to visit. Even our 14 year old grandson found it a good experience. Only a few rooms on both floors, and you could go

We had to find indoor activities as the boats on the Lake Ashi had been cancelled due to strong wind and rain. We googled it and found the website of this museum boasting their collection of over 4000 items. So we decided to give it a go. At the reception of the museum, we

The museum is the only one in Japan devoting for the Traditional Japanese painting- Nihonga. Conveniently located 5 minutes walk from the Pier. When you first walk in at the viewing dock, you will be immersed by the stunning Fuji mountain overview with the lake. All paintings
A poor choice of fluorescent lighting and reflective glass frames distracts from the beauty of the unique nihonga style of art.
Lovely small art museum, specializing in kaleidoscopes and Noh masks. Lounge has great view of Lake Ashi, and on a clear day, you can see Mt Fuji.

Currently exhibiting paintings of Masato Yanagisawa until mid-Sept '17. Beautiful depictions of primarily European cities. Only introduction in English, everything else was in Japanese. There were also good gift shops there where you can buy reasonably price prints, postcards,
This is a very well laid out art museum with traditional Japanese art as well as all of the other art forms with some amazing ivory carvings
An eclectic group of mostly contemporary Japanese artwork. This is a limited collection that will take only 30-60 minutes to absorb. Our party were charmed by it an purchased several reproductions.

If u love materials, it is a must see location as the beautiful Kimonos and the method in which they dye, weave the kimonos are simply awesome. some of the art form may have been lost now as the colours and designs are so intricate and rich.

We went there, because the lake cruise was cancelled due to bad weather. What a beautiful small museum with wonderful art. Enjoyed it tremendously. Beautiful watercoulours, Great landscapes, Good views over the lake from the museum coffee shop.
This museum has a lovely selection of art and fantastic views out over Lake Ashi. It also has a lounge area where you can sit and admire those views.

As others have noted, much of the art work in this museum was created using shavings of precious minerals that are more vibrant and longer-lasting tban oil or watercolor paintings. Highly recommended for a visit!

The paintings are unique because many of them are made exclusively out of shavings of precious and semi-precious stones. I thoroughly enjoyed seeing them. Also, the views from the museum are spectacular. This is definitely worth a stop.

Pretty. A nice collection of unique kaleidoscopes and some nice glass objects. The paintings were generally pretty but not special. And the entrance fee was pretty steep for such a small venue. The food was pretty good and the view across the lake was great.

While the collection isn't great, it's a wonderful museum to visit. From the bus station or boat terminal, it's right across the street and then up 3 escalators. There is a view across the lake and while we sat there, Mt.Fuji magically appeared. Perfect view from lovely tea
Well presented art works f differing styles. We had an introduction by the gallery director which was informative and interesting, Lovely view of the lake when it is not raining. Well worth a visit

It's a nice building with a good view of the lake and Mount Fuji (when visible). The collection is by contemporary artists but not very innovative. It's not very large. There are some nice things, but basically what you would see in a mid-range art gallery which you could

Following our trip up to the fifth station of Mount Fuji on a clear day (you only find such days 35% of the time), and then a sort sail across lake Ashi we ended up in a small town where it was a short trip up to the private Narukawa art Museum, located on the wood covered hills

This art museum houses traditional Japanese art which is truely beautiful but it is the scenery outside which is the biggest concurrence to the paintings. There is a huge terrace from which one has a spectacular view over the lake and if one is fortunate Mount Fuji ( we were not

The collection has many contemporary Japanese artists using traditional painting techniques. The art is beautifully displayed in bright open galleries. But the best attraction is the photo opportunity provided by the large window in the lounge which looks out over the lake at Mt

After taking a pirate ship across Lake Ashi, we walked up the hill to this gem of a museum. The view of Lake Ashi and Mt. Fuji is spectacular. We could see the lake but were being teased by clouds around Mt. Fuji. Nevertheless, they have wall-to-wall windows with comfy seating

The museum is small, but has some really interesting Japanese Modern Art- worth checking out if that's up your alley. This is great for most tourists though, due to the fact that is has an amazing view of Ashinoko, Hakone Shrine, and Mt. Fuji, and they've created a decent area

First of all the best thing about this museum is the view out of the window through which you can see Lake Ashi, the Hakone Shrine and sometimes, if you're lucky, Mt. Fuji. I liked the size of the museum too - three large rooms just about fits my attention span. And last, but

We visited here as an alternative activity as we were supposed to have a cable car ride but it was closed due to bad weather. I thought it would be a bit of a bore ,BUT in fact it was a really pleasant visit- lovely art work and an unusual collection of Kaleidoscopes. really

We happened across this museum while trying to look for the entrance to the ancient cedars avenue. I'm no art expert but found several works in the museum fascinating. The kaleidoscope displays, in particular, at the tea room viewing gallery were awesome! Couple of the

The museum has a very nice and reasonably priced shop. But the most attractive part of the museum, not so well advertised, is the tea shop which has a glass facade with stunning views of the Ashi lake amidst the mountains. This by itself makes the visit more than worthwhile. The

Not a huge museum but some very lovely pieces , ranging from large screen prints to sculpture and a display of kaleidoscopes . The paintings are modern scenes and not impressionist and are on two floors . The gift shop is small but interesting, the cafe has some fantastic views

It was a rainy and windy day and we wondered what we could possibly do that was fun and interesting. Visiting the Narukawa Art Museum was the exact and best answer to that question. I cannot tell you what a stunning sight it is to look out of their high window and see the
Outdoor escalators take you up to the gallery. The art is Japanese at it's best. Don't miss the view from the cafe.

The museum itself is beautifully designed with magnificent views of Lake Ashi and the pirate ships and torii and of course Mt Fuji. And the art work is modern Japanese with strong traditional elements. It is delightful uplifting and a joy to see the quality of the works.

When I finished my tour in the lake, I was in doubt what I could do next. Then I saw Trip Advisor about this museum. I entered with low expectations. There is a escalator from the street. When I saw the pieces of art... wowww. They are so delicate, so nice, so beautiful.

• Right across from the Moto-Hakone port/ bus stop, there is an awning which leads to the Narukawa Art Museum. This was not part of our itinerary, but seeking shelter, we made our way up to the museum, put our wet gear into lockers, used the free pass discount, and started

There has many beautiful Japanese arts. (Some of them is painted by a great master of art such as Ikuo Hirayama, Yuzo Kyama). The view from a lounge was great! You can see Mt.Fuji like a Japanese Ukiyoe art. Such perfect view is realized by the effort that staffs brush the
It was a small art museum. Our tour took us there to view Mt Fuji but it was cloudy so we did not see it at its best
A very nice museum with collections of Mt. Fuji art, a cool kaleidoscope display and many Japanese style paintings!
This gallery has a sensational view of Lak Ashi. We also enjoyed the art, well displayed and not too overwelming.

It was surprising to realize as first time visitors to Hakone area, that in its numerous art museums Western art appears to be more on offer than Japanese. The Narukawa Art Museum in Motohakone is a delightful exception, with an interesting selection of its vast collections of

This is a cool Japanese contemporary art museum in Motohakone. You can also purchase cool postcards here as a memory. The highlight here is that this place is supposed to be one of the best places to view Mt. Fuji. Pray that you're lucky and that Mt. Fuji isn't hiding behind

The concierge at the Fujiya suggested this as part of a sightseeing tour of the Hakone area. I'd been expecting a larger collection. That said, they had a fairly nice set of Japanese paintings of various styles. There is also a cafe and room at the back of the museum with
google: The small-scale art museum has stunning views. Even if it is just a window, it can make your mind purified. Moreover, the beautiful kaleidoscope is fascinating. 5 stars recommend!

Beautiful designs. Some of the text was in Japanese but they did have some translations and an English info pamphlet. Photos were not allowed in the artwork exhibits. What you see here is the kaleidoscope exhibit and garden and view onto the lake.

Amazing museum with a panoramic glass window that displays an incredible view of mount Fuji. On a clear day, the view is unbelievably serene and Fuji's cloud formations are awe inspiring. The rest of the museum when we were there contained paintings of Fuji, a collection of kaleidoscopes, and works representative of Japan
Best view on the lake and Mount Fuji, you should definitely come here
Gorgeous view of the lake and mount Fuji, beautiful display of Nihonga paintings. Neat kaleidoscope exhibit near the cafe. Worth checking out if you're in the area.

Lots of different Japanese artists are on display. I especially liked the kaleidoscope exhibit. Nice view of town and the lake. You can see the nearby shrine's torii gate in the lake. Watch the lake cruises come and go.
Offers great view of Mount Fuji. Good place to unwind and just enjoy the day. Nice and cool weather. It has an outdoor garden as well. Love it!
Stunning view on a clear day outside on the mountain top.  Unfortunately  cloudy & spotty rainy day for me.  Indoor AC museum had the most beautiful art.
I loved the kaleidoscopes, and the temporary exhibit of Takasaki Shohei's "Four Seasons" collection was some of my favorite paintings I've ever seen.

If u r looking for a picturistic view of Mt. Fuji, this is interestingly a good place to me… not what you probably would imagine to get the most out of an art museum but trust me, the view of Mt. Fuji coming from this place is impacable.

Great museum. There are escalators that carry you to the entrance of the building which is located on a hill. From the inside you have a great look over the lake and with clear skies you can see Mt. Fuji. The art pieces are also really nice.

Small but special collection of art created in the traditional nihonga style with pigments made from crushed minerals. Good explanation of the style and lovely art across two floors. Excellent view of the lake from the second floor.
They have amazing paintings 🖼 and the view is awesome, but the day that I was visiting I could not see the Fuji 🗻
You have to pay 1300 yen entrance fee to museum to visit the cafe. Too bad
Very good collection of arts and great views. You can see the Fuji-San and the lake and enjoy the area.
On tour and due to volcanic problems had a diversion to this art museum. Absolutely  fabulous.  Loved it
Excellent gallery with outstanding view window and cafe
Nihonga art in museum! Discount on website of museum.
1400YEN for a good view, there is interesting art as well.
Beautiful gallery and cafe with superb views. Definitely should be on your list of "must see" in Hakone 10/10

Houses some of the best art pieces from Japan. Take your time and absorb all the beautiful hand painted pieces followed by tea at the museum cafe which has the best view Lake Ashi has to offer. On a clear day you can see the breathtaking …
Place is far from the hustle and bustle of the city scene. Great place to go. Unwind and just observe art.
Small but excellent collection. Definitely worth the visit.
Small and great, i love museums that are well put together, small enough to enjoy in an hour, and full of beautiful stuff. This is one, the ivory carving is awe inspiring.
The photo and statue artworks were beautiful, and exquisitely detailed. I'm not a museum person but I highly recommend a visit here.

Yes its a great place to view Mt Fuji but the real attraction is the museums great collection of Japanese Nihonga paintings.  There are some great exhibitions with english language description to give insight into this traditional Japanese technique. Well worth a visit.
Nice spacious art museum with great view

Small museum in a scenic setting focusing on Japanese artists and Mt. Fuji landscapes.  Nice cafe inside with great views.

The lady at the entrance gave us a bunch of nice postcards showing Mt. Fuji in the various four seasons.

I would go …
Charming small museum with, among other exhibits, a large display of unique kaleidescopes.
The view is great. Nice exhibition with kaleidoscope and Japanese art.
Relax your self seeing the scenic beauty of mount fuji
You would have the whole view of the lake and red gate in front of your eyes here.
Great Japanese paintings
Loved it.   Highlight, definite a must-see!
Great view of Mt. Fuji & Lake
It is a small art museum. Alternate activities for the tour because of the typhoon :)
Very nice place. Very interesting.
so many different types of kaleidoscopes! extraordinary!

Can get crowded and people queue for photos - each doing several variations. Very busy at peak times and weekends. Incorporate the rope way and pirate ship rides.

Hakone Shrine stands besides Lake Ashino-ko. The shrine site is surrounded by beautiful nature. The mood in the shrine is quite nice. You may feel something special if you visit this historical shrine.

Arrived at the Shrine in a bus and then headed for the staircase to heaven. The entry to the Shrine is very impressive and the area is tranquil. One of those must do sites.
Amazing views , Must see in Hakone The lake is just amazing so clean and refreshing. try to avoid on a rainy day Beautiful serene beauty

The famous Hakone Shrine, close by the lake. It is known from Hakone Jinjya Heiwa-no-Torii by the lake. If you want to have a picture with yourself by the Torii, be prepared to queue. The main shrine is few hundred steps up from the lake. Nice lantern walkway leads towards it

The torii reminded me of Miyajima. We went there very early to avoid the crowds. Many people said this is a power spot.

A very peaceful shrine. I really enjoyed learning about the Japanese culture here and it was very serene.

This shrine is not nearly as busy as many of the others we visited, a nice break from the crowds. It is a nice walk over to the pirate ship and along Lake Ashi.

Very similar to any other shrine you visit in Japan. If you’re on a day out in Hakone then it’s probably worth the walk along the lake to see it but do t expect anything revelatory.

Not much to see here. Nice picture at the gates but kinda nothing. The village there is very nice though. It’s a cool walk around
We were unlucky Hakone was on clouds and under rain But even with this weather it always stunning and magical and at least no tourists Superb spot One of the symbol of Japan We ll come back soon !

Hakone Shrine was great. I went from Tokyo and took a bullet train to a bus. It took about an hour and a half to get there. You walk through the forest and see the big red arches and walk up the stairs and there is the shrine. A must see when in Hakone.

Japan is steeped in history and this is not to be missed! We found Japan easy to navigate, with many subtitles in English on Street Signs, Trains, and Roadways. Love how they have passed their history down from one generation to the next!
A must visit when in the region! Make sure you also take the opportunity to head out on Lake Ashi! If you are lucky you can get a glimpse of Mt Fuji from here as well.

Beautiful, serene shrine. Outstanding location and vistas. Well worth a visit. Takes a little walking.

Great place for photos and it is very peaceful. The color of Hakone Shrine contrasted with the lake is really breathtaking. We also got a glimpse of a couple in traditional clothes.
After experiencing Tokyo life and its effervescence, it was quite pleasant to walk there and even to queue in order to take a picture. A gentle break.
It was a fun and cool experience. The stairs are a bit of an exercise, but it was something I enjoyed to the fullest.

Very orderly, queues were formed for photo opportunities. Interesting peek into the architecture and local culture. There were some really old trees around the shrine, close to nature. Could use a little more translation for the write ups around the shrine.

Was one of the most beautifull shrine we visited. The walk up the patch was amazing. So green and lush. With the contrast of the red lanterns. Would love to go back and spend more time just soaking up the view.

Had seen photos on this website which made me want to visit. But none had prepared me for how ancient, beautiful and picturesque this area is. Humbled 🙏🏻
A Hakone landmark to which visitors should pay respects. The Shrine is a bit up the hill and a giant Torii is in the water of the lake.

Our Mount Fuji tour stopped here, but we only had about 30 minutes to see a number of attractions. I wish we had more time at the shrine. It was very crowded as there were many tour buses stopping here.

Is a nice location. You can follow the lake, walk up the stairs to the temple and then go down to the lake where the Tori is. From there you can walk along the lake on both side.

nice shinto shrine, and my picture of the tori in the lake with afternoon light will bring me confort in stressfull days....
